title: Overrated, overpriced, poor service
comment: You would expect that a 5 star hotel restaurant would have 5 star service, but unfortunately, that was not the case. The food is very expensive and the portion size is very small.  The staff were not very attentive at all and were very pre-occupied with other matters such as talking or standing around.  I was sat there for 1 hour after my plate had been collected and not one member of staff out of 5 asked whether I needed another drink or whether I wanted to see the desert menu - this was in an empty restaurant! When you decide to attend a 5 star hotel restaurant, you would expect a better service than this.

title: Great staff and lovely atmosphere
comment: Me and my wife had dinner in one of the igloos on Saturday and the staff were so lovely. They were attentive, informative and helped us to have a lovely time. The food was great too and it was overall a wonderful experience.

title: Great city views and the igloos
comment: Great city views and the igloos are very good. The food was good and the service was good too. Very strict on time and a hefty deposit. Would I go again? yes.

title: Not worth the price
comment: Lovely presentation of the food however no way near worth the price. Ordered a rabbit main and a roast chicken. Not as flavoursome as it looked. Something I could have cooked at home and would have tasted better. Mismatch of flavours in the roast chicken and the stacked potatoes in the rabbit main tasted like microwave food-no rabbit in the ‘rabbit main’. Would come again for drinks but definitely not for food!

title: Fantastic!
comment: Had a lovely dinner and drinks for two. Food, drinks and service was fantastic. I tried to reserve an Igloo but they were fully booked so we sat in the restaurant which was gorgeous. The server gave us excellent recommendations and the bar provided with a simple cocktail menu that held extraordinary tastes. We followed dinner with some drinks on the rooftop to enjoy the view.  Do yourself a favour and order the pork belly.  My one complaint would be that now I can never cook my girlfriend a potato dish again since they let us experience nirvana with their potato side dishes.

title: Service was disgusting
comment: Me and my parter stayed in the hotel which was nice and in the morning we went up to the aviary to get breakfast. Upon arrival no one even noticed we was there so was stood around for 10 minutes waiting to be seen. I was wearing a hoodie and jeans like everyone else in there at this time in the morning and my partner was wearing jumpsuit other females in the restaurant was wearing tracksuit bottoms and flip flops, however when we was finally seen we got told to go back and dress up as we would not be allowed entrance in pyjamas after explaining that they are not pj's we was told well it looks like it to me. The person was completely rude and disrespectful and would never go back there ever again!

title: Weekday bottomless menu
comment: Booked the weekday bottomless brunch where you order from the a la carte menu and pay £9.99 for unlimited alcohol. I was really impressed with the amount of drinks provided and the fact you can switch between Prosecco, wine and beer throughly the evening. Service was very attentive inside the restaurant. Yes, the food is pricey but it’s well presented and good quality - and you have to remember it’s a rooftop destination.

title: Overrated, outdated, poor service & Overall lacking!
comment: Booked this as a special occasion. Picked the pod as I wanted it to be special. The pod itself is cute, but very disappointingly furnished and quite bare. It felt like being in a cheap restaurant with just the outdated table and chairs in middle + the heater and a couple of fake candles in a lantern which were not even on. On top of it the door to the pod kept getting stuck, my boyfriend has to kick it open for the waiter to get in at some point!  There we no blankets as there is usually in pods like this one, and the heating in it wasn't all that. The table was not set prior to our arrival either - the waiter who looked poorly trained took few minutes setting the table as we sat there waiting. He also kept leaving the door to the pod open every time he came in to the pod which defies the idea of being warm outdoors! He was not rude but he was obviously not well trained and kept forgetting the order to mistaking what we asked for.  The rooftop view is ok but nothing too special. It's on top of a hotel which is outdated and needs renovation. Maybe I should have researched th hotel too before booking. We opted for a bottle of midrange wine which I hadn't tried before at £56 - it was more of an overpriced cheap bottle in reality. The food was ok - nothing special apart from the steak which in fairness was amazing. At the price of £160 for 2 ppl, I've had amazing dining experiences- this for sure was not one of them and left me quite deflated as it was a surprise dinner for my boyfriend's birthday. I say go somewhere else.

title: Rude staff
comment: Lovely views but rude staff. Did not make us feel comfortable and felt as though others were far more important than us.

title: Great help
comment: Beside the food and drinks being amazing there was an employee who provided great help named Sophia as she provided exclusive help and was very sweet and kind.

title: Adelina our waitress was fantastic!
comment: Adelina our waitress was fantastic , a real sweetheart and very professional, friendly & efficient and the food was delicious!

title: Just an Ok Igloo Experience
comment: My husband and I booked a dining igloo for a special festive night out. From a Covid perspective, the igloo felt quite safe. We were very surprised how crowded the restaurant was inside, so we were happy to be in a bubble outside away from everyone. The igloo had beautiful views over the city and we were comfortably warm throughout the evening. Service was stellar. I guess the biggest letdown was the food. My tuna starter was lovely, but the beef cheek was dry and not flavorful. The side dish of carrots was tasty, but the new potatoes were boring and uninventive. My husband thought his terrine starter was flavorful but lacking accompaniments of bread, but loved his main dish of bream. The chocolate cheesecake also did not work from a flavor perspective, and the restaurant added a strange glob of fruit mixture to my husband’s sticky toffee pudding. I was also annoyed when I ordered a martini and the glass was not even half full, and my husband’s first beer was flat.  We also found it odd that they added a service charge to the bill (which we expected), but then asked for additional money at the end to cover the “server tip.” What does the service charge cover then? All in all, we were happy to do something different during a tough year, but the whole experience was just ok. It was an expensive evening and we wouldn’t do it again just for the experience of dining in a glass bubble.

title: Never going back
comment: Me and my partner are under 25 and we felt like we were unfairly treated because of our age!  Like our money didn’t count and our custom wasn’t valued.  Everything felt like it was too much effort for them to do.  During breakfast we asked for drinks which were forgotten about, more than once!  There were several other unhappy customers within the restaurant, not a very good impression.  Ultimately the service charge in The Aviary is not worth it, one bit and I do recommend all the hotel and the Aviary staff have customer service training.  The only good point about my stay was the amazing food, thank you to the Chef and their team.  Ms keen.

title: Absolutely fantastic
comment: Absolutely fantastic food and service, great atmosphere, the igloo was amazing at night with great views of London.

title: Top cocktails and view
comment: Top cocktails, attentive staff, nice bar snacks, and a beautiful sunny day. Doesn’t get much better than this. Book well ahead as v popular

title: Loved it!
comment: Came here for my birthday weekend. Hotel is absolutely lovely, and the Aviary bar was so good! Went there for drinks on the Saturday night, and Sunday morning. The French manager and his team really made our visit. Made us feel so welcome and the service was brilliant!!

title: Visited for breakfast
comment: Visited Aviary for breakfast as we were staying in the hotel below. The waiters were nice but the food was very average. I had the full English and did not enjoy it as well as a hot chocolate that was lukewarm. My partner had avocado on toast which seemed a lot nicer. don’t think I will be returning

title: Overrated view and disappointing food
comment: The website looks great but you don't actually get any of the views if you sit inside. Decor is very dated, furniture looks cheap and lots of chipped paint. Lots of people seem to go there to take pictures only, so you've got your classic influencer crew hanging around and ruining the atmosphere. Food was very very bland and uninspiring. This place needs a total overhaul, as it would definitely have potential if managed well.

title: Awful Awful Awful
comment: I had dinner last night with two friends. We reserved for 7:15 pm. We were forced to wait in the downstairs lobby until 7:45 pm. We finally made it to our table. Although the food was tasty, everything else was awful. Waited for drinks order, waited to place dinner order, waited for our two bottles of wine to be delivered. Loud and chaotic place with awful service. Would not recommend.

title: We will be back
comment: Great evening at Aviary! Excellent cocktails and delicious food. Duck was absolutely divine! Friendly and very helpful staff especially one of the managers, Justina. We will back!

title: Mrs Wright
comment: Visited the Aviary, Pent House Palm Rooms with my partner for our anniversary. Despite COVID rules, we never felt troubled or inconvenienced. Absolutely incredible evening, and Sebastian our server topped it off completed. This man went above and beyond to make our evening incredible. Even went and organised us an anniversary surprise. Brilliant. !!

title: Outstanding service from Sophia and Roberto
comment: Had rooftop drinks with a view for my boyfriends 25th birthday celebrations, the cast from TOWIE were consistently rude to the waiting staff who were nothing but polite. I want to specifically acknowledge the happy and bubbly service received from Sophia and Roberto on Monday 17th August despite the way these ‘celebrity guests’ were behaving towards them. They kindly moved us inside when the producers for TOWIE demanded us to sit silently whilst they filmed. Would recommend this bar for cocktails with an amazing view.

title: Booked here for my 40th birthday
comment: Booked here for my 40th birthday meal after reading all the great reviews . If I’m being honest I would book again for drinks as nice setting but I would not eat here again the food was average and disappointed as did expect it to be better .  The staff were friendly enough but not great on watching when drinks needed to be replenished , I always had to get someone’s attention to order another drink

title: Great day!
comment: I was speechless this is the first impact with this beautiful place. The restaurant and the view are incredible, the food is 10+ as well as the service. I recommend with confidence. Last but not least, thanks to Catalin for making our stay more pleasant. Definitely I will come back!

title: Amazing experience!
comment: We went to have dinner and drinks me and my girlfriend, the food was delicious and the staff was amazing.  Thank to all and especially Catalin!  M &A

title: B-day dinner
comment: It’s my second year I celebrate my b-day here, with my family. Everything was great, from greeting, service, food and cocktails. Not to mention the view, that it’s breathtaking at sunset. Special mention to Riccardo, who was taking care of our drinks, we loved it. Thanks!  Amazing evening, I felt very special. I’ll make it a b-day habit.

title: Beautiful place
comment: Great evening with friends We really enjoyed this rooftop bar. Great drinks and always warming greetings and service. Special mention to Riccardo, our bartender, who made the best Old Fashioned drinks. Many thanks mate! You were great! Gonna return for sure!

title: Lovely evening
comment: The first visit to Aviary was made with my husband, on the recommendation of a good friend. We were really impressed by this place, so we decided to spend the night between the years in this wonderful place. Thanks to Catalin Brînză for the recommendation and for the services offered.  I can't wait to come back to Aviary.

title: 60th celebration
comment: I went with 5 friends this week for a special 60th birthday. The service was rubbish, the lights inside the igloo did not even have batteries in them so we could not light them. The website shows tablecloths, candles etc there was none of that. The tables were two wooden tables pushed together with scratches and dirty artificial flowers. It cost a fortune and my friend who organised it for her husbands special birthday was so so upset. Would definitely not recommend and i hope the owner who reads this contacts me so my friend who paid for the whole thing can get some money back. PS there was no soap either in the mens or ladies toilets and we brought it to their attention but by the time we left they still had not put any in there, considering these times that should have been top. of the list, thank god we had sanitiser

title: Awful Venue - Ruined Birthday
comment: Looked like a really nice venue however service was so poor. Booked an igloo for 6 people and the service was so bad, we were told it was table service however our waiter kept disappearing/ not checking on us regularly enough so every time we wanted to order again we had to keep getting up to find him.  Moved to the terrace where I had a booking for 15 people. It was raining and despite being told the day before if it rained we would be moved inside and saying on their website we would be moved inside if it rains. We were told that we either had to stand outside in the rain or leave as there was no space inside due to corona. Their excuse was 'we can't control the weather' however, as I told them, they can control the way they manage their bar , use common sense and decent planning and make allowances for bad weather since we do live in England where it rains A LOT. Made the booking a month in advance to make sure I'd have a nice birthday but the service here was disgusting!!!

title: They are back!!!!
comment: OOOOOH YES!!! This visit was so over due, didn't realise just how much me and my wife had missed this amazing place - just for the record, the best Roof Top and Customer Services in London. Cocktails on the Roof Top late afternoon catching the last of the August swelter. Great table service, quick and efficient as always. Tucked in to some amazing platters, squid, hummus and the chorizo and sweetcorn croquettes, just the right sizes and a perfect accompaniment with our drinks. Back ground music just the right vibe. Special thanks as always - Jola Blaut for your behind the scenes work, and Ricardo, Catilin, Sofia, Daniel and Robert (Papi - you haven't lost your touch with superb cocktails) - you guys are an asset to ETM, that's why we come! Looking forward to next time....just don't forget the Wray & Nephew :) :) :) lolol

title: Only 1 issue!
comment: Lovely clean hotel with excellent staff and really nice rooms and amazing rooftop bar. My only issue not allowing 5 stars is they should be giving hotel guests priority over the pre booked rooftop bar. We had to sit inside whilst people not staying at the hotel was enjoying the outside view. This isnt fair.

title: Amazing cocktails, great view!
comment: My partner and I went there for our anniversary. It was great overall. It felt safe (covid-19) and the service was prompt and friendly.  Cocktails felt a bit expensive (around £13) but not more than in a lot of places in central London, and you don’t get that view in many places so it’s definitely your money’s worth.  Whilst talking to Robert, a lovely manager from Cape Town, we found out how much care and effort goes behind every single cocktail. And it shows! We tried a few on the list and they are amazing. I recommend the Flamingo Frizz and their Whiskey Sour. Great for special occasions, we’ll book again!

title: Not worth a repeat visit
comment: I had dinner with friends and while the venue is fine, the service was poor and the food just ok. No one came to take our order, we had to catch the waitress's eye, and we must have been reminded three times we had to be off the table by 745! Once the main course came we had 45mins to eat it and then of course there was no time for dessert so that wasn't even offered. Pretenious, not a relaxing place to eat, and not worth the money just to peer across the room at city rooftops.

title: Appalling service.
comment: ooked a table at The Aviary ROOFTOP bar for my boyfriend’s birthday. The only time slot available was 10:15pm.. nowhere on my confirmation email was mentioned the fact that the rooftop terrace will be closed after 10pm, so as soon as we got there , we received the lovely news and we had to sit indoors .  Also, the birthday platter that was arranged prior to our visit , and confirmed via email, never arrived!  When wanting to order food, the waiter without hesitation, just told us that the kitchen was closed .. and nothing can be done about it . Luckily the manager on duty was kind enough to speak to the chef and let us order something from the menu. Not impressed with the service for a such prestigious place . Customer service definitely needs some polishing.

title: Dinner
comment: Great buzzy restaurant. Very reasonable prices, good food and great service. Good views from roof terrace even in the rain. Excellent addition to a stay at the Montcalm.

title: Birthday occation
comment: I booked to go to the Aviary for my boyfriends birthday. The staff at the front of the hotel were welcoming however, when we reached the restaurant on the 9th floor a front of house waitress was not so welcoming, I asked if we were able to sit near a window (as there were two tables for two free near a large window when we arrived) however, this request was quickly shut down as apparently they were fully booked however, nobody sat in these tables during the time me and my boyfriend were seated. We both ordered the steak as a main however, this was slightly overcooked however, the staff did bring out a small dessert with a candle for my boyfriends birthday (but i did request this before hand). After the meal we asked if we could sit out on the open air terrace for drinks however, was told it was also fully booked (i emailed the restaurant a couple of days before the booking as was told that the terrace could not be booked for small groups, as it was first come first serve, I felt really disappointed) however, this may have been a blessing in disguise as there were absolutely no social distancing measures on the terrace at all as people were not stopped from just wandering out there with drinks. A really disappointing visit and I would not recommend it, nor will I be visiting again in the future.

title: terrible customer service and did lied about been fully booked
comment: I stayed in the hotel in the same building as this bar, so myself and my partner decided to have a few drinks at the rooftop bar. As we approached the entrance we were greeted but we weren't eating so did not need to sit down. We were directed to the rooftop reception instead. Everything was fine until we approached the rece[ption area was a female and male was standing waiting. I asked if we could get drinks to take outside and the female rudely said "no we are fully booked". I said ok that's fine. The male said we could book online but its fully booked Friday and Saturday all day. So I said ok again. As we were only there one night, we wanted to see the views, so I asked if we could take pictures. The lady said yeh. but she looked really uncomfortable talking to us as if she did not have the time for a conversation. it felt rushed. So I and my partner went outside and took pictures. I was outside for 10 minutes max but realized there were at least 5 tables free. we stood by a bar table which was free the whole time we were outside. I thought that was strange but thought yeh they are booked for whenever people come. As we come inside, I approached the lady to ask her a question and she rudely said again, "sorry we are booked Friday and Saturday", but I didn't even get a chance to voice my question, I had to say, hold on, I'm not asking about that. I was asking about how to order food and sit inside like just wanted more information on how the place runs. the lady and the man started to repeat again, if I want to find out more, I would have to book online as they have no room. I checked online after I left and see they did have slots available for the time we were there and later, even on the Saturday. so they were not FULLY BOOKED. They were rude in how they delivered this information and rushed us so that we could just go! that is how it felt. we left but was very upset and disgusted on the customer service. I WILL NOT BE GOING BACK HERE. I think they approach people with a level of classism. so if you don't fit the upper-class culture, you are not welcome. We were dressed smart but still felt turned away in a subtle way.

title: Excellent service from the Aviary
comment: Just back from our anniversary treat in London. As well as the great review of the hotel I just wanted to mention the excellent attention from everyone at the aviary rooftop bar. The hotel and bar seemed to be doing all it can to provide safe and respectful distancing, given the time we are in this was much appreciated. The staff at the Aviary seemed so attentive and by the end of two days we felt as if we had become friends, the manager who’s name escapes me, Sophia, Daniel, Sabastian, cocktail man with the beard, everyone....all smiles. As it was our anniversary we even had a little treat on the table, these things make a stay and was really nice.  So nice to leave with great memories and we will be booking again for October shortly.  Many thanks guys.

title: Came here to celebrate my
comment: Came here to celebrate my husband’s birthday and our 8 year anniversary and it was truly a romantic and wonderful experience and evening. Our igloo was set up beautifully, Food was delicious, great customer service from all staff we encountered especially the security guy on arrival, the restaurant manager and our waiter Tomas! He and the manager really paid attention to us, made sure we were topped up with drinks, presented our food beautiful and was so friendly and went the extra mile to make the night special. They reserved a table for us at the bar for after drinks when dinner was done (so we didn’t feel rushed to leave). Also I have to send compliments to the chef! Husband is a chef so going out to eat is always hard but he thoroughly enjoyed his meal and the flavours as did I! Sea bream cooked to perfection husband’s steak cooked beautifully also. Starters where delicious also. Thank you  Setup of the igloo, restaurant and bar were both beautiful! Romantic and chic establishment. Thank you to the entire team for your wonderful service and creating a beautiful experience for us. Would definitely recommend and will be back here again.

title: With great views...
comment: Had a friend over from Peru so looking for good food and with good views over London. The staff on arrival seemed friendly and the menu has some nice choices on it.. the food was very nice and reasonably priced too.  One only comment was it maybe lacked atmosphere but it was a Sunday night on a stormy weekend..! Think would try again in the summer.. Views were great and definitely worth a visit... Phill Southampton

title: Excellent!! Great place and
comment: Excellent!! Great place and amazing food with the professional service of Anais waitress, very kind and polite. After we move to the bar where the drinks were like the place, incredible! Thanks Ibai for look after us, It was a date to remember, definitely we’ll be back.

title: Lovely meal with a view
comment: Such a lovely restaurant and amazing view of the city! My friend and I had a lovely meal and glass of wine with their winter set menu deal. Service was great, we felt very well looked after, would definitely recommend!

title: Terrible food
comment: Despite the courtesy of the staff (the one thing that makes me not give 1 star), the experience was pretty bad. The place is ok, nothing special, and it is a pity that the balcony closes at 10pm. What is unbelievable is the quality of the food. One of the poorest price/quality ratios in London. The meat (tried both the short ribs and a steak) was chewy, the chips (hard to get them wrong) were the poorest quality frozen ones, the fish (cod with rosti) was overcooked and the rosti was burnt, leaving a very sour taste in your mouth, and the list could keep going..... Overall terrible restaurant, would not recommend, if not for a drink on the terrace.

title: Valentines Day
comment: Really pretty venue, top floor, little bit hard to find but worth it. Great food, good selection of cocktails. Really lovely and attentive staff. Only downside is the garden shut at 10 so we couldn't get a picture.  Also has nice toilets :)

title: Excellent restaurant and food, staff fantastic and helpful.....
comment: Had dinner here last week and was excellent. Had the set menu which was very good and well presented. Staff were wonderful, very attentive and helpful. Small glitch with the final bill, but all sorted quickly and efficiently. Not cheap eats, but pay for what you get and view is fantastic across the London night sky.

title: Stopped by here for a drink
comment: Stopped by here for a drink on the rooftop bar with a friend visiting from the states. Olivier was beyond friendly and gracious upon arrival! (As always!) Our outside winter bubble was sheer perfection! The wine and food always 5 star! Love this place!

title: wasn't the best visit
comment: I went there around 3-4 years ago for my birthday to have a meal, and I was told I can't order anything until they hold on to my bank card. I am a black person and was very offended on my birthday my birthday. Still have my receipt.

title: Amazing place
comment: Been here a few times for food and drinks, both are amazing. The staff are lovely and to top it off there are great views of The City!

title: Amazing experience
comment: We went there with some friends to have the 3 courses menu. The place is really wonderful, rooftop with a beautiful terrace and a nice view. We asked for the 3 courses menu were you have some options to choose. The chorizo and sweetcorn croquettes are amazing as starter. then I had a cod fishcake with langoustine bisque that was so tasty, maybe the decoration was no "top" but for this price is enough quality. I finish with a toffee pudding with some caramelised apple. Later we had some drinks on the terrace with the view . I recommed this place for everyone who visit the city.

title: Rooftop heaven
comment: Excellent breakfast.....service exceptional, and nothing is too much trouble. The layout and design standard , make the Aviary a very relaxing area to dine.

title: Booked breakfast for my wife
comment: Booked breakfast for my wife for a big birthday, excellent service, the manager was very accommodating and went out of his way to ensure we had a lovely time. Would definitely recommend a visit

title: Beautiful
comment: This place is gorgeous, to go with your family/friends. I love the atmosphere, everything is nice and warm.

title: Stunning!
comment: From the amazing views, to the superb food and service. Definitely recommend. I dined alone and as a solo diner I wasn't uncomfortable.

title: Anniversary dinner
comment: Came to the avairy for our 1 year anniversary and can definitely recommend. The views and food were amazing, we had oysters and prawns followed by the beef burger and the sea bream. We also received complimentary Prosecco on arrival for our anniversary and a free pudding to share! The waitress even brought over some complementary shots for us as she found out we were students. We had such a good evening here.

title: Lovely experience!
comment: Great experience. Daniel It was outstanding in service, very nice and respectful. Such a unexpected surprise with birthday treat (mini cake and cundle) AMAZING views and environment!

title: Good food not too expensive
comment: Limited vegetarian dishes but the food was pretty good considering what they had. Also the non- vegetarian dishes were excellent. The server wAs super friendly although she also had a lot of table so it wasn’t always easy getting her attention. We sat indoors and the atmosphere and service were great. However I would recommend trying to get one of the outdoor “aviary” seats for a special experience.

title: The views!!!!!!!!
comment: We have revisited this hotel and restaurant on September 1st for the past three years to celebrate our anniversary. We love it here so much. It is definitely a five star experience. Staff are amazing and friendly. The food is quite pricey but it is delicious. And if you’re only here once a year then we deffo think it’s worth it.

title: Lovely experience
comment: Lovely experience had a pod on roof top  Excellent service  Special thanks to the lovely lady we met in the lift that gave us complimentary champagne for my birthday  Superb cocktails and all staff were lovely and couldn’t do enough for us  Would highly recommend  Thank you all for making my birthday one to remember xx

title: Stunning views, great service and food!
comment: Thank you to the staff and our server Inis! Everyone at the restaurant is delightful. The food is SO GOOD. The ambiance is equally spectacular with the skyline. We had the truffle aranchini starter, the scallop sea bream for the main, and the vanilla cheesecake. Everything came out perfectly. It is also a looks like a great venue to rent for small events. Cheers!

title: Nice Hotel - Bar clientele let down though.
comment: Great welcome, nice large room, well equipped, good bathroom. Very courteous and helpful staff. The bars very noisy, nowhere to get close to a quiet late night drink except in your room. Non residents in the bars quite rowdy and need reminding that swearing is boring and offensive.

title: Works Christmas meal
comment: I would like to send thanks to Natalie and Danilo who helped with the planning of our works Christmas dinner at the restaurant two nights ago. We had a diner with very specific religious and health dietary requirements and the team there pulled it out of the bag and served him a meal that was custom made and he was able to eat it all. The staff are very attentive and a good night was had by all! The view is pretty special too!!

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
comment: Avoid at all costs. An absolutely awful experience. We left the wrong room number on our bill and instead of calling to the room, the manager from the restaurant came banging on our door at 11.30pm. I was in the shower and my boyfriend wasn’t in the room at the time. He rang on the doorbell at least 6/7 times and was banging on the door for over 5 minutes. When I reported the incident, the general manager told me there was nothing he could do as he had reviewing the knocking and could only see the member of staff knock twice, an absolute joke. These people will try and take you for a an idiot. I wish I wish I wish we had never gone, £140 for a dinner which was mediocre, service awful and a manager that apparently doesn’t prioritise his guests. Won’t be returning.

title: All round Fantastic!
comment: Having worked with Hannah from ETM group on a past event she really helped me pull out all the stops for a last minute Christmas dinner for 20 people at the Aviary and was first class in service from the moment I contacted her for help!  Firstly the views are incredible at The Aviary which gives this wonderful restaurant the X factor before you even sit down. The staff were all very efficient and you can see that they work incredibly well as a team to ensure every person is happy, fed and watered. The food was delicious, the mushroom aranchini was my favorite! A fabulous time was had by everyone, one of the best Christmas dinners we have arranged so a big thank you to all the staff to help make this possible. I look forward to returning when the sun will be shining to make the most of the terrace. We just wish the terrace was open a bit later in the evening.

title: Team Christmas Dinner
comment: We had an amazing night at The Aviary for our work Christmas party. Anna was fantastic in helping us get everything planned and organised, and the staff on the day were more than accommodating, especially when some of our party getting a little over excited! They were super patient and could not have done anymore to make sure we were having a great time. Thanks all!

title: Work Christmas Party Drinks and Nibbles for 35
comment: We had a fabulous night in the Aviary for our Corporate Christmas Party. Natalie was our Events Coordinator and worked with me to arrange the food and drinks within our budget. Sophia our dedicated waitress was terrific and did a great job serving all of us with a smile on her face. I would not hesitate to have another event there.

title: Mr William
comment: Denisa proof that an excellent service with a personality and a good heart can change a bad evening in a remarkable one and thanks again dear for your amazing way of knowing what a persone need in certain moments.

title: Fab bar, wonderful view, great atmosphere
comment: Came here one Friday after work with some friends, glad that we came. The drinks were so good, and the DJ was playing some great tunes. the views were amazing and we took some fabulous photos.

title: Dissapponinting
comment: Staff really rube and unprofessional.. Bartenders really slow on the service. You can easy find better choices.

title: Excellent service especially
comment: Excellent service especially for the very professional waiter George, in a very nice place with a fantastic view!!

title: Good option for parties and event
comment: Staff is very professional and friendly. Reception girl front of lifts was amazing and polite. Good place to hangout with friends. However, food need to be improved.

title: Very Pleasant Evening
comment: Wasn't sure at first as we felt under dressed (jeans- and trainers - hadn't planned to go here) but that didn't seem to bother the staff. Food was excellent, nice red wine, great service and great fixed menu price.

title: Customer
comment: Had an amazing time. We reserved an amazing table inside the igloos and it was only topped by the amazing service of Denissa ! Would definitely visit again!

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: Came here for my boyfriends birthday dinner saturday. Restaurant wasnt busy a few tables. The food was outstanding really amazing, expensive, but worth it. However, the service was not great not what i was expecting at all. I was very disappointed and upset. No special effort was made for the special occasion not even a "happy birthday". But you HAVE to pay a 12.5% service charge. Not once was I asked how my meal was. My boyfriend was asked how HIS starter was but that was it during the whole meal. No one was bothered how it was? I have had such better service in alot of other places. I did expect a lot more after reading the reviews. Once we paid i asked a lady to collect my coat from the cloakroom and she then asked another lady who sighed and rolled her eyes. So rude. Wouldn't return and its a shame as the food was some of the best we have ever had.

title: 1 star is generous - appalling service
comment: As we were staying in the Montcalm, we decided to treat ourselves to breakfast in the Aviary. From the very moment we stepped into the aviary we were made to feel unwelcome. We were abruptly greeted by a host who looked to be the manager who told us that our breakfast was downstairs, however when we said we wanted to pay the supplement he again said “your breakfast is downstairs”. Once he finally understood that we were willing to pay for our breakfast, he told us to wait at the end of the bar with no further explanation... we didn’t know where we would end up having breakfast!  After a 5-10 minute wait a female host went through the same list of questions before seating us at a table - making us feel very unwelcome. It’s also worth noting that we heard the staff talk to other guests in the same way. After waiting for a considerably long time and making eye contact with every single member of staff, no one came to take our order so we decided to go and take a look at the buffet option.  We were honestly appalled to see the bare minimum of food - there was a dish with one sausage, no beans and no eggs, oh and also no plates! Considering this was a £22 breakfast we were absolutely shocked and decided to leave because it clearly isn’t worth your time or the money. It’s also worth noting that only half the restaurant was open... hardly being rushed off their feet. The hotel staff heard of our issue and said they’d be in touch as they seemed shocked too, nearly a week later and we’ve heard nothing. Would avoid this place.

title: Birthday celebration in one of Aviary's snug winter igloos :)
comment: Firstly I want to say thank you to Jo who I've been dealing with via email regarding my booking of the igloo - she's quick to respond, friendly, professional and very accommodating.  This booking was for my partner's birthday - we both had a great time! There's a few igloos on their outside deck but because it was relatively quiet, we did manage to get the igloo in the far right corner which offers the best views and comfier seating.  Loved the fur covered seats, mini fireplace, little lights and lamps dotted around... plus the blankets giving it that real Christmassy feel :) Our waitress, I think her name was Federica (sorry if I've got it wrong!) and another waiter (I didn't catch his name) were both very attentive without being intrusive.  The nibbles that came with my booking were more than enough for the two of us and were lovely! My only comment would be to have a bit more of a mixture in the bar menu as we found of a lot of the nibbles were dry items (i.e pitta bread, croquettes, almond nuts, arancini).  Thanks again for looking after us and making my partners birthday extra special. Hope to see you again soon! x

title: Late night drinks
comment: We had eaten elsewhere but wanted somewhere a little different to have a few drinks to finish of the evening. A google of the area found the Aviary Bar with rooftop views. Can't believe I've not been here before! We ordered a drink and went onto the outside terrace which had amazing views of London. There were several patio heaters dotted about so it was lovely and warm and the igloos looked really cosy for a meal. At 10pm we were made to go inside as this is when the roof terrace closed, which is a real shame I think as we would have loved to have stayed outside for longer. But we perched ourselves at the bar and really enjoyed watching the bar staff make the cocktails and answer any questions we had about them. The Bloody Mary cocktail was very nice! We didn't eat here but took a look at the menu and it looks really nice, so definitely something we will try in the future. Drinks in general were a little pricey but worth it for the view, just a shame the terrace closed early. I would recommend this place and we will be returning.

title: Beautiful breakfast
comment: Amazing breakfast, great service and gorgeous views. Stayed in the hotel for the night and thoroughly enjoyed visiting the restaurant for breakfast. Great menu and happy to make to order.  Restaurant Manager is on the scene to make sure all customers are happy. Great service!

title: Amazing place
comment: Two weeks ago, a friend recommended me this place and I decided to take my girlfriend there. When we arrived the first thing that caught my attention was how beautiful everything looked and the views of the terrace. We decided to go ourselves to order the drinks. We were looking at the cocktail menu but we didn't decide what to drink, so we asked a bartender. By surprise "Davide" surprised us by creating a cocktail for us. We really liked the way he served us so we went to him all afternoon. I would like to add that he was very professional and patient with us. We will return soon to this place.

title: Great view
comment: We were visiting London for our anniversary alongside our aunty and uncle. We wanted a nice rooftop restaurant to celebrate at and my aunty booked us in here. We arrived bang on time and was asked if we wanted to have a drink on the terrace first which we said would be lovely. Our first round of drinks were £33 for 4 drinks which consisted of 2 large wines and 2 beers so as you can see drinks were not cheap but then guess this is pretty standard for London and especially rooftop bars. Views were stunning, the sun was just setting so it looks beautiful. We spent about 20 minutes outside and then went in to eat. We were greeted well and were seated at a table by the window which was lovely. We all decided what we were going to eat and the men had decided on the pork chop but when the waitress came to take the order we were told that this was the only thing on the menu that they did not have. Men were gutted as this is what they really fancied but they opted for the chicken instead. They said that it was nice but nothing overwhelming. I had the lamb rump which was nice but as i couldn't have some of the accompaniments (due to intolerances) they gave me a side dish of potatoes instead but it was really small and I was still absolutely starving after i had finished my meal. As I cannot tolerate sugar very well I cannot have puddings so it meant I left the restaurant very hungry which is not great when you have spent £25 on a meal. I emailed the restaurant a few days before going to explain about being gluten free and some other food intolerances i have but no one got back to me which was dissapointing. I have to eat gluten free and there are quite a few options available and i am sure they would tweek recipes if they could. The staff were lovely, the service was good but this only gets a 3 star rating from me for the simple fact they did not have what the men wanted, the chicken was average and I left hungry. I probably wouldn't return, I would try another roof top restaurant instead.

title: Fantastic Views, Service and Food
comment: This place is just fabulous. Amazing staff, friendly greeting, nothing to much trouble. Our waitress, sorry cannot remember her name, (she was French) was so attentive without being intrusive. Lovely food, reasonably priced and very tasty. The cocktails are wonderful. Outside is the rooftop terrace with stunning views, pods, and well worth a visit. Cannot wait to visit again. Fantastic. We followed lunch by a spa, also very good. I will be giving a separate review.

title: Fantastic Food, service and views
comment: We stayed in the Montcalm whilst on a weekend break in London and couldn’t visit without a visit to the Aviary on the roof. Great food served by friendly efficient and charming staff. My Wife is gluten free which was absolutely no trouble and the choices were many.  We know there is a lot of choice in London but with the views this must be a first choice, you will not be disappointed!

title: Doesn’t quite soar
comment: The birds in the white cage by the stairwell and the entrance to Aviary on the tenth floor of the Montcalm Hotel Finsbury Square look plastic. The views of even taller concrete heights or the flat concrete roofs of car parks are unprepossessing. The set menu we had booked through Open Table was uninspiring, one of the mains a burger and chips for heaven’s sake. So we stick to a la carte. My wife’s chicken salad was a substantial dish; my steak frites comprised a chunky mound of sliced bavette, perfect chips in a basket, a good peppercorn sauce. We went off piste ordering a filet of salmon and chips for my daughter, but at a staggering £24 was only £1 less than the set three course menu also including salmon albeit with leeks in a consommé. Neither of the two beers on tap I had ordered were available but I was given a bottle of Weissbeer on the house. Coffee came with complimentary petits fours.

title: View makes it worth a visit
comment: Just enjoying the view over London. Aviary was a recommendation by our hotel and the barkeeper has been so nice. So in case you're here in London and have no plans for the evening, come here. The cocktails are sweet, hope there will be no hangover tomorrow. Next to the mojito we got some snacks, wings and cheesesticks. Also something to opt for. Not too expensive but definitely higher priced than back home. Continuing my night now, bye

title: Peacock fizz
comment: We had a spa day at beauty by melody and after went up to the Aviary bar for a cocktail.  We were amazed by the gorgeous view of London. The cocktails were delicious, we had a peacock fizz which looked and tasted great. The staff were so friendly and welcomed us and made sure we knew what cocktails were available. The bar is lovely and modern and the view was the best.

title: Thursday evening
comment: We decided to visit this restaurant for the first time on Thursday evening before going to a concert. Food was really lovely and the service great too. Would definitely recommend. Thank you.

title: Beautiful place, shame about the food.
comment: We went here for dinner last night to celebrate a promotion, the view is incredible, the servers are absolutely lovely and the restaurant itself is beautiful. Unfortunately the food let it down. I ordered the croquettes for starter (the waitress was really friendly and let me order these despite them being classed as a “bar snack”.) but I asked for no aioli. they arrived with the aioli so I had to ask for them to be sent back, and the second portion that came out were delicious BUT freezing cold in the centre. We ordered mains, my partner ordered a steak with peppercorn sauce, but béarnaise sauce was delivered. Again had to ask for this to be sent back. My seabream was absolutely delicious but there was a sauce underneath it which was cold, which led to the entire dish going very cold very quickly. Like I said, the staff were attentive and lovely, we didn’t want to make a fuss so didn’t complain about these things but on reflection we probably should have done so that we could have ensured we had a perfect meal. It’s a shame.

title: Great venue for instagramers -Great food too
comment: We had a wonderful evening on the 9th floor of The Aviary. The igloo was very inviting the food, amazing, the views, just perfect. We brought our daughter here for her 18th and it provided just the kind of Instagram opportunities she needed to put a perfect end to a perfect day – and we quite enjoyed the experience too. The waitress who gave us her undivided attention and had quite a difficult job on a cold night, is the best person that has ever waited on us anywhere. Thank you. She deserves a big bonus!

title: Bar are the Best!
comment: We went there for a couole of drinks and the We discover another world. There it was the supervisor Ibai and he recomended all the drink what We want. After a few minutes We start to doubt it, but when thay come, it was exactly what We like. Ibai it was the perfect one for recomended cocktails and he told as it was the new menú and he did, the menú was súper cool and We tryed ugly duckling, Dark turpial and Kira falcon. The way like Ibai treat us was perfect. He have my 10 with him. Thanks for the expirience

title: Birthday Breakfast!!
comment: Lovely breakfast, friendly service & beautiful views of London! It was my husbands birthday & they gave us a glass of bubbles each, very nice touch!! We will be visiting again! :)

title: Not impressed! Terrible attitude from door staff!
comment: You would think you were trying to get into Berghain in Berlin the way the door staff downstairs act.. looking you up and down seeing if you are Worthy.. worthy for what! The the over priced cocktails, BASIC view of LONDON (not as good as Madison nearby) and FAKE flora and fauna on the terrace.. which when we arrived was booked for a private function, another thumbs down.

title: Market risk analyst
comment: Top girls - Sofia, the Indian girl, was really nice and professional, she made our evening even more pleasant.

title: Views great, food less so
comment: Visited today for lunch. It is a great location with some incredible views of the skyline including lots of new developments. Staff were fine, some seemed less well trained than others. We had some bread and butter whilst checking the menu; bread was ok but the butter had not long left the fridge and had to be shaved off, which is difficult when it’s presented in a little pot.  My friend and I both had the chorizo and sweet corn croquettes for starters. They were quite tasty but not very warm. Have had better. For main course I played it safe and chose a burger. It was £17.50 so I was expecting something pretty impressive. It was not. Over cooked and rather small patties. A dribble of cheese and yet another brioche bun. The chips were ok, but if you can’t get chips right, you may as well give up. My friend had a chicken caesar salad which looked pretty good, but he wasn’t impressed enough to mention it. All in all, excellent place for a drinks event, but lunch very forgettable.

title: Rude waitress/ waiter
comment: What a lovely place I must say , Shame about the rude staff waited 20 min for my drink wasn’t busy at this point had to wait till after my food was served sitting there with no table water and waiting for my drink so in my opinion the service was very very poor so when I said I will not be paying the service charge then me and my parter was hounded by 2 waiters asking why we are not paying it we then gave the reason why they still wasn’t happy and ask for a third time witch is very embarrassing in a busy restaurant at this point they then all stood there while we finished are drink making use feel very uncomfortable so for that reason I wouldn’t bother returning again I’ll be telling everyone else I know who wanted to go there.

title: Top Barman
comment: I came with my girl to aviary to have some drinks Where We meet Ibai ( bartender ) who prepare amazing cocktails! Very recommended, great drinks and great views!! #TOP

title: AMAZING VIEW IN THE CITY
comment: Wow this place really surprised me. The view from this rooftop bar is just insane. I was also super lucky because of an amazing pink sunset overlooking the city of London. Cocktails are really good as well. Very recommended!!

title: A quiet haven in bustling London
comment: Spent a few days in London on business, staying at the Montcalm Royal, and stumbled upon the Aviary. Superb food, ambience and insights from the host, Olivier. Highly recommended.

title: Oh Dear
comment: Very disappointing. More like patio than roof terrace. Appalling customer service, one to miss. Walked out bar staff more interested in serving under 25’s, totally ignored. Attitude when we left of the Gent on the door appalling. I was offered chance of seeing Manager but couldn’t really be bothered as having seen attitude of bar staff, a fish rots from head down. Glad didn’t end up wasting my money.

title: Great cocktails and amazing service!
comment: Last Friday I visited Aviary for the first time and I have to say, that I think I found my new favourite spot for cocktails in London! I went with a group of friends just for drinks and the cocktails that were recommended to us by the bartender Tiago were great! We had a nice chat with him, he had a lot of knowledge about the drinks and was very friendly and accommodating. Great atmosphere and a great place to be on a Friday evening!

title: Not bad. Probably not worth the money.
comment: Came here on a Saturday with my boyfriend for lunch - our waitress was lovely and the service was top notch! Couldn’t fault her at all, she worked really hard and nothing was too much for her. We had some drinks outside on the terrace too which was lovely in the sun and the restaurant has excellent views. However, we were approached by some extremely drunk men whilst chilling out there whom tried to pull us out of our seats - there should be a policy to throw people out past a certain stage but it seems that the place were too keen to take their money maybe instead of worrying about the peace of other guests! I had the prawns for starter and the risotto for main - both were fairly bland - the flavours seemed to be all on the prawns shells rather than on the edible parts. The risotto looked fairly colourless and unappetising also. The cocktails were great - albeit a little overpriced. It seems that you are paying for the view! Would probably not return.

title: Wedding anniversary meal
comment: We visited the Aviary for dinner on the 8th Sept for our first wedding anniversary. When we arrived at our table we were presented with a complimentary glass of champagne which was a lovely touch. Our waiter (sorry do not remember his name) was fantastic! He took us through the menu, recommending food and wine pairings.  We had a 3 course meal and I can honestly say it was exceptional, we both agreed it was the best meal we’ve ever had in the UK.  The restaurant is beautiful, the views are amazing and the food was second to none. We’d highly recommend!!

title: Very bad customer service
comment: I went to this terrace to drink with some friends the cocktails were good but at the menu level and waiter is too confusing being that they wanted to make us pay for things taken from other menus and waitress who first offers blankets and then forgets to to carry them while passing near us several times,we will evaluate whether to go back... but we are not sure.

title: Friendly staff make this place extra special!
comment: First trip to the Aviary restaurant for a family celebration breakfast, and not disappointed. Food was great - we all tried different things and no-one was disappointed :) But what made the visit extra special was the friendly service, particularly Olivier who went out of his way to look after everyone. Friendly, attentive service - it should be so easy but it can be rare to find so a shout out is due when you find it!! It was a great way to start the day, breakfast inside, drinks on the rooftop terrace. Will definitely find an excuse to come back :)

title: Aviary
comment: Came here with a group of friends we sat inside as it was to busy outside. The table service was ok as a group we had bottles of sparkling wine and many cocktails the flamingo riff we found outstanding. My wife and I had a few bar snacks the humus had a nice taste but the chorizo croquets were quite bland,also we ordered a round of drinks 25 minutes later asked the waitress, she forgot even thou it was written on her notepad this hotel is ment to be 5 star we got a three star service not good enough for the amount you pay, overall there’s better.

title: Cipri
comment: Excelent experince in this amazing place . Drinks,Food and Service absolutly beautiful. Many thanks to Riccardo and all staff from terrace and restaurant. See You Soon Aviary!!!

title: Corina
comment: Amazing venue and amazing customer service..... Drinks and food was absolitly delicios!!! Was first Time visiting London and this venue was defenitly recomended by my friends. We absolitly enjoyed and we defenitly recomended!!! Good Job Aviary!!!

title: Lovely Friday evening
comment: We were running late for our dinner, we phoned up to the restaurant and the lady told us that there is no problem, they will keep our table as long is needed. Upon arrival tall dark hair lady welcomed us and guided to the table promptly.  Dinner was amazing, no one rushed us up. We could enjoy our experience. Only one thing the music was a bit loud . But can understand-Friday night. Overall superb experience from the beginning till the end. We definitely coming back!

title: Great spot for a drink!
comment: Lovely spot for a drink - especially in the sunshine! Good selection available and attentive and friendly staff!

title: Amazing views and tasty food
comment: We left the Aviary full of positive emotions. The views were stunning and the quality of cocktails blew our minds. The food we ordered came promptly and was super delicious. Our server Alex was a superstar and we will make sure we are back as soon as possible!

title: Wonderful service at Montcalm
comment: Received an excellent service for a corporate event from Denisa Sandu on today's event. Excellent view and great drinks.

title: Wowwww
comment: What a view i arrived late they close at 10 on the terrace but i had 20 mins or so to take in the view and it was wowwwww

title: Outstanding service and beautiful food
comment: The staff were all outstanding. Very kind and considerate and went above and beyond to make our meal an absolute pleasure. Will definitely be back.

title: Night out
comment: Amazing night out with lads. Our waitress, Denisa was amazing apparently have to write Denisa moree than 100 times. Denisa, Denisa, Denisa, Denisa

title: Great place for Breakfast!!!!
comment: The Aviary is a great restaurant, beautiful rooftop views, and great food! The service at breakfast is outstanding, Olivier was so friendly and helpful, some of the best service that I have ever received - he even helped me plan a day in London after my other plans had been cancelled. I would highly recommend this restaurant!!!

title: City boys, plastic food, and building sites.
comment: Popped up here for a late and light lunch early on a midweek afternoon. Not the best experience. Never got past nibbles which were plastic "international hotel" faire. Waved towards the terrace where we had to find ourself a table and beg spare stools from other tables to make it useable. Sat there for a while being ignored by the visibly stressed waiter until we reluctantly contributed to his workload by calling him over and asked for menus. These were obtained by going round other tables and collecting spares. Terrace is perhaps characterised as dull and therefore overpriced cocktails, populated by shouty city boys, overlooking the various building sites that constitute the eastern extremities of the City of London. Maybe we'll do it properly and go half a mile further north-east next time. Hipsters are so much more tolerable than an un-ironic homage to the 1980s

title: Lovely food and atmosphere!
comment: I came here yesterday (13/08/2019) for my boyfriends birthday, we were quickly seated and drinks were taken, and they were absolutely gorgeous. The waiter was very friendly although I didn't appreciate him reading out the specials when we'd had 15 minutes to look at the menu and had obviously read the specials (but that's personal opinion). The starters came out and they'd brought me the wrong one but I didn't mind as we weren't in a rush. The food overall was gorgeous, although £40 for a ribeye is quite pricey. I would definitely come again

title: Had a good time here.
comment: Having read some of the negative reviews I was a little worried about coming here. I needn't have worried as it was fine. It was a beautiful sunny day so the outside terrace was very busy so we chose to sit inside and have our drinks. The cocktails were great, I had a Peacock fizz, Aviator and Flamingo Riff, all very different and enjoyable. We got our drinks at the bar ourselves you don't have to have the waiters. We went to our table which was right by the staff room and service area but we didn't let this bother us. We could have asked to move if we wanted to. We were looked after fantastically well by Barnardo who wasn't too much, just there when you needed him. We were given complimentary prosecco for our wedding anniversary (22 years) and at the end of the meal sweets on a Happy Anniversary plate. This little touch was very much appreciated. Our starters of courgettes in batter, sweetcorn fritters and garlic prawns were delicious. Four prawns at £16 is expensive but they were well worth it. The vegetarian starters were very reasonable at £7.50. I had the cod which was great, my husband had a burger (good) and my daughter had chicken (good). I don't really know what people find to complain about. Couldn't manage dessert so paid and left and all agreed it had been a very good experience. Several staff said goodbye as we made our way out. We visited on a Tuesday at 5.30pm.

title: Denisa, jokes jokes jokes
comment: Denisa was absolutely the best host, her jokes were fantastic and made the evening. Employee of the year. 10/10

title: Wonderful Setting, Food and Ambiance
comment: This was my first time at Aviary and will most certainly be back.  There was a group of 10/11 of us and we were impeccably looked after. I cannot remember our waiter's name, but a charming young man who ensured the service was attentive but never intrusive. We opted for the £45 3-course set menu and I found the choice more than fine. I went with: - English heritage tomato salad for starters Pan fried fillet of Seabass for main Milk chocolate brownie for dessert There is also the added bonus of the stunning rooftop bar, with remarkable views across The City. All in all, The Aviary is a great venue to take your partner, clients or your work team. I will certainly be back.

title: Great Rooftop Bar
comment: Great views, outdoor and indoor bar. Very chic people but also for a relaxes drink. Very friendly staff.

title: Outside seating area
comment: We had a table reserved for us, a family of four sitting outside. the staff were so helpful, polite and friendly - they really made you feel welcome. When our drinks arrived, the service was impeccable. I did not take her name (I think she may have been a manager) but the lady with dark hair and in a colorful dress, was extra special.

title: Great breakfast in a wonderful spot overlooking London - Thank you Olivier and Team
comment: We stayed at the RLH Montcalm for 2 weeks with our children. Breakfast in the Aviary everyday was a treat. Olly and his team made us feel very welcome, my kids skipped up there each day. Great selection and really tasty food, friendly staff who smiled at us and chatted with our kids, a really good all round service. Dylan will miss the sausages and Maddy the babychino. Thank you guys

title: Wonderful Summer Afternoon Spot
comment: We didn't have reservation but were staying at the hotel and the host was able to slot us in a table Friday afternoon for lunch. The outside bar was packed with people on the beautiful summer day. The inside restaurant had a nice breeze. The wait staff was prompt and friendly. The cocktails were refreshing. My friend and I split the spiced spring onion and courgette fritter with mango chutney. They were delicious, could have eaten more but we had our mains coming. My friend got the roasted fennel, broad bean and lemon risotto with mascarpone and kalamata olives. It was delicious, as I had a few bites. I had the miso roast cauliflower and kimchi slaw with peanuts. The slaw was delicious. The cauliflower was way too salty for my liking and I like salt. It was so salty I couldn't eat more than a bit or two of it. The waitress did ask if everything was okay and I didn't care to mention it so that was on me. I was just to jet lagged after my flight being delayed 4 hours. I needed to get some sleep. The service was excellent. I'd just cut back on the miso a little bit.

title: Cocktails with an amazing view
comment: Had lunch, dessert and cocktails. We all loved our main courses and they looked great. Desserts were divine. Friendly staff. Quite expensive so would come again for a special meal, wine list is expensive.

title: Great Private Hire for Business Event at The Aviary
comment: If you're looking for.a breathtaking venue with a great view of the city then book part of the terrace out for a private summer party. Both the drinks and food were great and our clients loved the experience. I absolutely love this rooftop restaurant and bar! Highly recommended.

title: Great breakfast at the cozy terrace :)
comment: What a great start of the day! Beautiful weather to have breakfast at the rooftop of Aviary! Kudos to your fantastic team, especially shout out to Anton who recommend the best choice on their menu and really friendly guy who makes sure everything is fine on our table. Definitely a five star experience for us :)

title: Lovely birthday meal
comment: We went here with friends for my 40th meal and it was lovely. The set menu was great and although the drinks were expensive it is what you expect in london. The view was fantastic and wish we had of spent longer. Staff were lovely and polite.

title: The best breakfast place!
comment: I had breakfast with my family here and we had the loveliest time. The food was delicious and the service great. The staff were really friendly and always happy to help, especially Katrin, who went the extra mile making sure we were well looked after. We will definitely be coming back again and I would most definitely recommend it as the perfect breakfast place in town.

title: After work drinks
comment: Expensive drinks but a great experience due to the views and vibes. Bar and outside area are adjacent to the restaurant. Blankets and heaters are available for outside in the evenings too, as well as an outside bar open occasionally.

title: Lovely Roof Top Terrace
comment: Sat and whiled away the time with a coffee one sunny Monday morning. Very relaxing in the sunshine. Open all day for hot and cold drinks. Closes at 10pm.

title: Really nice bar area overlooking Finsbury square
comment: We just went for a drink to the top floor (8th) of this building and it was great just to sit there and watch the world go by. There is a restaurant downstairs on the 7th floor although we didn’t go

title: Fabulous Breakfast with Fabulous View
comment: It took me a little while to find a nice breakfast I can take my friends who came to visit me from Germany. So, I came across to this Venue called Aviary on the top floor of the hotel Montcalm. I first thought it must be for the hotel guests only, but after making a call to Aviary, I received the information that I can just come in between 6.30am and 10.30am. Awesome! So, the next day me and my friends went there all together and and we received a very warm welcome by a gentleman whose name was Olivier and by the other stuff. We were seated and went for buffet breakfast with lots of selections including hot foods. By the way it is a self service! The breakfast was very delicious and the stuff took care of us. The view and the service was so amazing that made us to sit a bit longer and enjoy the atmosphere. Thank You so much!

title: Rude staff, overpriced food, amazing view (especially from Toilet)
comment: The staff here were the rudest staff I have dealt with in London (especialy as you wait for the lifts), the food wasn't anything special and was very overpriced. The only redeeming factor was the view from the terrace and the toilet.

title: Very nice breakfast
comment: Been coming to the Montcalm for months every 2 weeks. Aviary breakfast has always been great, very busy weekend service and even though it can be hectic, staff and management are always on top. See you in 2 weeks. Thanx Lina for great coffees and Geovanni.

title: Not what we expected.
comment: Crowded, very noisy, poorly prepared steak temperatures and pounding background drum beat for ambiance made our birthday gathering very difficult to appreciate.

title: Nothing special
comment: I wanted to like this place, I really did. It is rooftop, with amazing views of the city of London.  They have a really good selection of wines and cocktails, but the menu is quite limited. I tried the Suffolk Belly dish for £20. While I enjoyed the pork belly itself, the accompaniments did not make much sense and I was left feeling confused and dissatisfied. The blood sausage did not have to be there at all. The service was good, nothing special.  On thing I didn't like is that they don't accept cash, which is a bit annoying and inconsiderate.

title: 40th birthday drinks
comment: This place has the potential to be great. The views are amazing, the terrace is great and the decor looks fantastic!  What lets this place down is bar staff, one in particular was so rude to my friend and I while we were ordering drinks and requesting info on what tonic they had available. So much so that the guy standing next to me also commented on how rude he was. When paying the prices we were paying I expect a decent service!! Also they don’t accept cash? Why?? Such a pain!  The atmosphere was great there was a slight hiccup with a a fight early in the evening on but it seemed to have been resolved quickly.  I wouldn’t rush back...

title: lunch in the sunshine
comment: We had an early lunch at this roof top restaurant and it was very lovely. The staff were accommodating, polite and attentive. The food had a wonderful plant based choice that I often don't get anywhere else. The prices were standard, the view amazing and I really enjoyed it!

title: Terrible!
comment: Having read such rave reviews I couldn’t wait to try Aviary for breakfast last Sunday. Upon arrival the manager seated us promptly but from there it just went downhill. Once seated I ordered a cappuccino and orange juice from our waiter and my husband ordered an Americano. Twenty minutes later the server had still not returned with our beverages nor to take our order! I had to ask 3 times before our coffees finally arrived. I told the inept waiter that I was still waiting on my juice and he said it was coming shortly. It never did so 10 minutes later I helped myself to a glass from the buffet. I expected he would’ve at least been gracious enough to not charge for it but alas not so. Then the food arrived and all I can say is, it was what I would’ve expected at a roadside diner. My husband ordered fried eggs and toast. The eggs were over cooked, the toast was a slice of very thin bland cheap white bread. There was not a single garnishing on the plate, not even a slice of tomato or sprig of greens to cheer up the plate. I ordered the eggs benedict. It tasted fine but completely average and again no garnishing other than a piece of wilted watercress. It looked tired and unappetising. This meagre meal and shocking service cost a whopping £37. The restaurant is clearly understaffed as evidenced by a frazzled manager who was doing his best trying to get the waiters to speed up. I overheard one waiter complaining to the manager he was too busy and would not take on any more tables. Very unprofessional. I would not recommend this for the food or the service, especially given the high prices.

title: 50 th Birthday Lunch before Concert
comment: 50th birthday lunch before P!nk Concert......................I wanted to like this......................................., but alas it was not to be. Service somewhat hit and miss, eager to take orders, but then a long wait for food and drink to appear. After we had finally finished lunch, we ordered a bottle of Bubbles and some more 'men' drinks and said that we wanted them out on the terrace. We were told by the waiter at this point he could only deliver them to the table and not outside, pls bare in mind we had at this point probably spent close to £400, not exactly what we wanted to hear. One Rooftop Terrace that I won't be rushing back to.

title: Absolutely amazing
comment: The food, atmosphere and view is just stunning!  And such a welcoming and serviceminded staff. We are just so excited! The perfect surroundings for our perfect weekend.

title: Excellent all round
comment: Visited this morning for breakfast and had a great experience. First of all, the service was faultless; every member of staff was polite, friendly and efficient, it really was service with a smile. We both ordered the French toast which was delicious and after I was surprised with a birthday treat, which was such a lovely thought (and tasty too!) The restaurant itself is very nice too with views over the city. Thank you for a great visit, we hope to return soon!

title: Madison's is great. This is better!
comment: This is our new go to bar for the summer. We just chanced upon Aviary while walking from The Barbican to the Hoxton hotel. We never made it to the Hoxton! The venue is stylish, the staff are lovely and the music is great although some current dance music would be ideal. Madison's is lovely too although being in the centre of The City the customers can seem perhaps a little more competitive in style (they all look very stylish) whereas Aviary is a little more varied with a mix of very stylish customers and many wearing more relaxed but still smart clothing. It could have been the hot weather of course. I can't wait to go back!

title: Amazing views, Slow Service
comment: It's certainly not the service that keeps me going back to Aviary ; It's the view. On a gorgeous summers day it really is the perfect roof terrace to take in the delights on London. With it's comfy outdoor sofas, high-rise tables and outdoor bar it really makes for a very charming setting. The service however is incredibly slow. On my first visit I thought this must just be a once off. However, several visits later and the serve is still shockingly slow, and this is even on days when the weather has been less that favourable, so it hasn't been as busy. Service is sped-up a little with the outdoor table service, but in all honesty I think they just need to employ more staff. Despite the slow service, the staff are friendly and knowledgable about the range of drinks and cocktails on offer and I certainly don't let it put me off going. I wouldn't rush in the winter months though, as it really is the outdoor terrace that makes Aviary. The inside of the bar is like any other London bar, with incredibly loud music, they just have a better view. Perfect location for summer drinks on a warm, sunny day, just don't expect to pop in for a 'quick' drink!

title: Awful experience!
comment: Had a table booked with friends for birthday lunches and were really looking forward to trying this place out. My friend arrived 15 mins early so was waiting at the table for us. Was not offered any drinks in this time.  We arrived and ordered glasses of fizz. In the 2.5hrs we were there we were only offered drinks once! Service extremely slow and waiters looked like they really didn't want to be there. My friend ordered the sweet potato salad. She had less than a quarter of sweet potato and the rest of the dish was a very dry quinoa. Burgers were nice but nothing special.  We asked to speak with the manager on shift - didn't get her name but blonde haired girl. We had to ask twice to speak with her and on both occasions she went to serve other tables before coming to see us, after we had requested 15mins prior.  She couldn't explain as to why none checked on us or offered us any more drinks. Offered to take the drinks and salad off the bill and we made a very swift exit to spend the afternoon and a lot of money elsewhere!

title: A great spot for Business lunch on sunny day
comment: I absolutely love this rooftop restaurant and bar. The food isn’t exceptional but the scenery is perfect for sunny business lunches near the office! Someone mentioned in their review that it is better than Madison: to me it’s not fair to compare as it is different. Madison has the view of st Paul’s and a better food (more elaborate menu). However Aviary is convivial, less pretentious with good quality standards, very well located in the city.

title: All round excellent
comment: Excellent meal at Aviary on a Saturday evening. Excellent food, attentive waiting staff and a great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it.

title: Great
comment: The service from Alex was excellent! I enjoyed the atmosphere and food but thought the music was a bit too loud. The portions of the food were good. It was a cold day so we didn't really go to the bar but I think it would be the perfect on a sunny warm day.

title: Breakfast
comment: A fantastic breakfast today - the buffet was the best I have had in this country. The staff really made it though, they were extremely friendly and entertaining! A must visit. We will be back!

title: Breakfast
comment: The best breakfast in London. The food is fantastic and the staff are so friendly and welcoming. I can’t wait to go again

title: Lovely view, great drink
comment: i had a great cocktail by very talent bartender, the view is great! can see shard. we also had breakfast, the food is super!

title: The most amazing food and view! But I'm disappointed for when we were about to pay.
comment: Totally worth a visit!  Food - Amazing. One of the best meals I've had.  Service - Really kind and knew all about the food and whine and was glad to answer any questions.  The only thing I reacted to was when we were about to pay.  It was me (woman) and my male friend who had dinner together.  It was me who booked the table, and I also wrote in the booking that it was a birthday dinner for the guy.  During the dinner when my friend was asked if he wanted another drink, he looked at me and asked "if it's ok?" (I mean, the waiter could see that he asked me).  When we were ready to pay, (I) asked the server for the bill. And before he went away (I) also asked if they take cash.  And still, when the waiter came back with the bill, he put it straight down on the other side of the table, right in front of my guy friend, when it was me who was gonna pay it all.  Not that anything should make the waiter assume wich one in the company will pay. But if he now wanted to assume that one of us is paying it all, there was NOTHING telling that it was on the guy. Except that he's a guy and I'm a woman.  I've worked as a waitress myself and think there's nothing more right to always put the bill in the middle. You have no reason to assume which one is gonna pay. To put the bill in front of the man with no reason is just nothing more than pure sexism.  Beside that, the we had an amazing evening.

title: Rooftop Chaos
comment: How does this place get away with charging the same prices as top London restaurants? At that price you expect top service and quality - definitely not the case here. We arrived after drinks in The Ned and The Gherkin and were shocked by the difference in service in Aviary. When ordering we were informed that the lamb and beef could be ordered only rare or well done - nothing in between. At 39 for a small steak with no sides and 17 for a burger, this is unacceptable - either the chef is incompetent or the kitchen is under-staffed. Both tables either side of us complained about their food. One had the cost removed from their bill, with the other table the waiter just stormed off without responding (after asking how the food was). On a positive note, the dessert was sublime and the cocktails absolutely delicious. The view from the terrace is impressive. However I cannot recommend this restaurant as there is no emphasis on customer service or serving quality food. Unfortunately your money will be much better spent elsewhere.

title: Nice place to dine with a beautiful views
