comment: Me and my partner were celabrating our anniversary at this place and I can say that the food we had was very nice. We felt a little overdressed as some people next to us was wearing tshirts and trainers even knowing they have a dress code (?). Staff was very nice and polite and was ensuring all the time that we are fine with our food and drinks, which was lovely :-) At the end of our meal we were giving a complementary glass of prosecco to celebrate our anniversary. Would we go back? Yes!

title: Great views and bar - drinks very expensive
comment: I have visited the Aviary on multiple occasions and it is a nice bar with great views and a good crowd of people with a varying age range.  There are some negative aspects: Igloos that are there for the winter do become irritating when they are still there in March and it is a nice day. Perhaps they should take these down in February going forward so there is more space on the outdoor terrace.  Be careful if you are ordering drinks. If you would like a single spirit you will need to specify this as the bar men will just pour you a double even if you didn’t ask for it. I have also noticed that prices vary each time you order a drink from varying barmen, seems like they just charge whatever they want.  Drinks are quite over priced when there are many other bars in the area but I guess you are paying extra for the location and view. I would therefore recommend only staying for one or two drinks unless you want to go home from a night out bankrupt. I would definitely recommend visiting this bar due to the views and location but do just be aware of ordering drinks and the bill you are racking up.

title: Good portions and great vibes
comment: I went here with friends for dinner and I was surprised with the good sized portions given that I didn't really need sides. The food is also of good quality. The restaurant has a relaxing and comfortable atmosphere with good vibes and staff were attentive. The views from the rooftop are also amazing.

title: Disappointing service
comment: We visited the Aviary for drinks in the evening. Due to the open, island layout of the bar (which looks great, by the way), there are many areas one can queue for a drink. I stood close to two of the bartenders and patiently waited for over thirty minutes to be served two cocktails. This would not have been such an issue if it wasn't for the fact that several customers that queued after me were served first ! It took another unfortunate couple next to me to complain to one of the bar staff before our existence was acknowledged. No apology from any of the staff for the wait, but I appreciated this at last got the attention of the bartenders. The drinks looked very presentable but did not deliver on flavour (one tasted like cold tomato soup, the other had a lot of rosemary added which overpowered the drink). Not sure if it was just our bad experience that soured the taste. The best part of the visit was the view, it's a great location and the lighting/decor really adds to the relaxed vibe of the place. I am trying to make this a positive and constructive review but I find it difficult to excuse the service I experienced. It really is a shame as the venue is fantastic and I was given rave reviews about the drinks and food here. Perhaps I just got unlucky this time and should visit the restaurant instead. For future attendees: queue nearest to the tills or, be very obnoxious and queue jump, as these transpire to be only method to get served in a timely manner.

title: Incompetent
comment: Ordered a cheeseburger. 40 minutes went by. Nothing. When they finally brought it out it was barely warm. No attempt to rectify such as not charging me for it. Just appallingly incompetent.

title: Early evening dinner
comment: Visited this evening whilst in London. Food was of a fabulous quality. Burger was just average. Busy and bustling bar quite noisy so don’t expected a quite meal!  Drinks were a little over priced, serviced in nice glasses. But gin wasn’t served as it should be & at £12/£13 a gin glass should be a minimum.  Lots of staff who were all very attentive and excellent and deserving of the service Charge !  Food good, drinks over priced, despite this overall a nice meal, attentive staff hence only 4stars.

title: Loved it
comment: Came here for dinner with two friends and absolutely loved this place. Didn’t receive the friendliest of services on the ground floor bar when I received my white chocolate cocktail but once we arrived upstairs in the restaurant, the service we received from all the team was amazing.  The food, location and decor was great and will definitely be back. Crab starter was really nice and the chicken with gnocchi. I found the gnocchi slightly over salted but apart from that it was great. Didn’t have desert but tried some of the cheesecake which my friend had ordered and it was really good (just not a desert person). Cocktails, wine, staff, amazing.  I don’t remember the gentleman’s name that served us or the lady actually but I think he was French Jeffrey (so sorry if it was wrong, terrible with names) but thank you for service with a smile.  See you guys soon.

title: Bad food, the view was ok.
comment: We went for lunch there. The food was not worth it, better have eaten in a pub and pay the 1/3 of the money. I don not find any reason for someone to visit aviary, there are many other better choices worth your money, at least for food and view...(shard, galvin at windows) Maybe drinks, cocktails are better...

title: Mum's Birthday Lunch 🥂🍽👏!
comment: What a lovely rooftop Bar/Restaraunt. My Sister booked the table as it was our Mums actual birthday on Easter Sunday no less so it was an even more special day than usual. We were a little early for our booking but thankfully our table was ready for us.  The menu was impressive too, three of us had the Salmon Fishcake with Poached Egg (deliciously runny also ) whilst the other two had the Cheese Burger & the Lamb Sunday Roast.  All were tasty including the sides of Cauliflower Cheese & Dauphinoise Potatoes. I have *one tiny* observation so please do not view this as a critique as its not meant as one... When the Waiter was taking our order he was straight onto our food but bless him we had to give him our drinks order *after* he took our food order.  Being someone who has worked in a few restaurants in his time as well we are always prompted by the management to get that drink order in first & foremost every single time.  Just something to remember, other than that what a lovely Lunch we all had!

title: Good service but the food was a let down
comment: I went for the steak and triple cooked chips, the steak was okay but a bit tough for a medium rare cut. The triple cooked chips looked and tasted like they were cooked two times last week then microwaved.

title: Too expensive for what they offer
comment: Service was good. Staff was attentive and nice. Food average but very expensive. Yes they have a view and yes there are many places in London that have better views and better food. I would not come back.

title: Drinks & Dinner
comment: Visited Aviary on Saturday night with friends. Enjoyed a couple of drinks on their lovely roof terrace before having dinner in the restaurant. Food was really good, and although service wasn’t bad it could have definitely been better. Nice place and a good atmosphere.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: Went there last friday for a birthday dinner. Booked through ooen table, nice and easy, it is on top of a hotel the staff outisde are very helpful and make sure you don't get lost. We arrived before 8 and our table was ready,I would say we were welcomed by the hosts but that would be an over statement, rather cold reception with blank stares and no smiles. Once we were sat our waitress was brilliant and super friendly. We ordered a bottle of wine and decided to have oysters to start with we were asked if we wanted as glass of champagne with that as the wine was a red, it was a great idea and soon after we had a dream appetizer with a perfectly matched drink. Ordered the chateaubriand with hispi cabbage and blue cheese and some dauphinoise potatoes. We were told it would take around 30 minutes to cook and the waitress suggested we enjoyed the views from the terrace while we waited for the main course. Unfortunately this backfired a bit as we spent the whole time waiting in the queue to get outside before our server came back to tell us our food was ready. The steak was very nice and cooked to our liking, the potatoes were a bit bland and the hispi cabbage was really tender but could use a little bit more blue cheese. A manager cleared our table and we asked for the dessert menu. After that nobody offered any more drinks nor did we receive the desert menu. As we did not want to spoil the rest of the evening after waiting for a fair amount of time we asked for the bill and settled it. This could have been so much better of aN experience however we must have came there on wrong day. Eventually we made it to the terrace and the view was really nice they also have dining pods there which seemed to be popular. Overall nice place but would rather go to Madison's.

title:
Amazing!
☀️
comment: A great experience! I was impressed by the service we had and we thank Mr. Cătălin B. who made us feel great. What a gentleman! The place was stunning... My friend was impressed and told me she had one of the most beautiful nights in her life. Keep it so!

title: Birthday Igloo
comment: Been in Aviary last Saturday with friends celabrating a double birthday. Place was busy and ambience was cool. Got some dessert arranged by our waitress, lovely touch! Quick and professional service. Thanks to all especially to Catalin and Alina! You guys made our night. Will definately return summer time!

title: Wonderful Service from Friendly Staff
comment: Had a lovely lunch time meal here with really good food and excellent staff who were very attentive and friendly at all times. Restaurant soon filled to brim and had a good atmosphere.

title: Table and igloo
comment: Went there Saturday for a birthday pre booked a table first and then a igloo. When we arrived just shortly before our table time the staff were there to greet us and introduce themselves and then showed us to our table which was ready with ice chilled drinks and the staff made sure we had everything we needed then and throughout the whole night, amazing service, great chilled out vibe and atmosphere, I’d say it’s classy sophisticated bar with great service and staff. Would highly recommend to anyone to go there you won’t be disappointed.

title: Wonderful
comment: Was staying in the hotel and had a Sunday roast. The food and service was so good that we returned the next day for lunch. All the staff are attentive, kind and happy to be of help. The food is of high quality and cooked perfectly.

title: Great Views
comment: The views are fabulous and I'm sure in warmer weather the rooftop is a great place to be. However on the evening we visited it was freezing and damp so we came inside and ordered a bottle of wine. But where to sit? Nowhere free and 3 corners of the bar cordoned off for private parties. So in order to enjoy our wine at a leisurely pace and in comfort we decided we'd eat in the restaurant. Good plan we thought but unfortunately we found the food rather bland. Staff were pleasant enough and the decor is nice. But as we left we noticed that both the bar and cafe/restaurant on the ground floor were also cordoned off for reserved parties. Perhaps we were just victims of the hotel's obvious success as a reception venue. It is obviously better than average but based on this visit I'd say good rather than very good.

title: NICE VIEWS!
comment: We came here for post-meal birthday drinks for my girlfriend's birthday. We came from Borough Market and it was very easy to find. The cocktails were on the pricey side and you won't find your regular/classic cocktails on their menu. The views are great and you definitely get the feel of something quite classy.

title: Awesome Aviary
comment: Food was top quality, had fish followed by sharing some outstanding desserts. Staff were attentive and views amazing from most tables in the place. Recommend

title: Nice Views, Terrible Food
comment: Girlfriend and I went to this restaurant for her Birthday meal last night and was thoroughly disappointed. I'll keep the review short; - Nice setting/decor/views - Ridiculously slow  - Terrible food, we were served tiny and massively overpriced starters that were not warm - Then we were served cold and dry mains that felt like they had been sitting under a light for half an hour. Sent ours back and received apology and fresh sides but no money off/offer of free drinks, nothing Unless you're just going for a nice drink with a view avoid this place at all costs, so much better in London.

title: Great choice of drinks, fab views
comment: We love visiting the Aviary bar. The drinks are good as are the staff and service. There is rooftop seating so if it’s lovely weather (which we were lucky to enjoy in February) you can sit outside. They also have private igloo style seating you can hire at £200.00 which have blankets and heaters for those chillier evening. Definitely worth a visit and you do not need to stay at The Montcalm to go up for a drink. I have attached some photos... ;)

title: Amazing dinner
comment: Amazing lunch in this typical restaurant! The menu is very diversified and the food was so good and fresh. Highly recommend if you want to eat some food with good quality and a breathtaking view of the city. The service is top!

title: Occasionally Delicious Dishes
comment: Aviary is a rooftop restaurant and bar on the top of the Montcalm Hotel on London's Finsbury Square. It is a quality location with really good food. The view from the deck is not especially dramatic though. Getting to Aviary means taking the lift to the 9th floor then climbing another set of steps to the restaurant. The place is busy of a weeknight evening but not full. The ambience is good but not buzzing.  The atmosphere is appealing thanks to well thought out lighting which adds to the appeal. The place looks good and has a touch of class about it.  Seating is comfortable but there is only just enough space between tables. The dining environment is pleasant though and benefits from this place not being too raucous of a weeknight. There is a vegetarian option for both starter and main. The starter of fritters with a type of chutney is excellent. The combination is delicious and the texture is perfect. A nice entree. A main course of risotto was ok. Not as good as the starter for sure. There was not much other than the risotto rice on the plate and it was coated in a bland sauce. A side of potato dauphinois was superb. It was a magnificent and creamy version of the dish with a pleasant combination of textures. Definitely worth the addition. Dessert was fantastic. A rhubarb trifle with whisky cream tasted as good as it sounded. The portion size was decent and the combination was delectable. Unfortunately one of the main attractions of Aviary did not live up to expectations. The rooftop view is boring. This is not one of the more interesting angles London can be viewed at. It certainly is not as photogenic as might be imagined. The deck itself is nice. The pods which presumably are the avian theme look odd but they are at least eye catching. Price is not extortionate considering the location on top of a luxury hotel. It is not a cheap eat but is definitely not ridiculous. Service was patient and generally attentive. There was a sense of respect in the interactions. As a place to eat Aviary is mixed but when it gets it right the outcome is simply delicious. The view though is disappointing.

title: Rooftop bar
comment: Due to living in London you can sometimes get stuck going to the same places so this was a change. Unfortunately not gone on the best day regarding weather but the views still amazing of the city. Drinks are good but slightly on the pricey side. Service was very good also. There is also private pods on the roof which I was lead to believe you have to book. In summer this is a place I am going to go again.

title: Great view, delicious food, incredible team
comment: Went to the Aviary for breakfast last weekend. Couldn't of been happier. As well as a buffet breakfast being one of my most favourite things ever, to top it off, it was served by one of the loveliest teams. A big thanks Olivier, Margarita and Irena for the wonderful service :-)

title: Spend the extra for an Igloo
comment: Organised a surprise for my partner to visit the Aviary.  It is a must to spend the extra money and get an igloo, what you spend to reserve comes off your bar tab at the end. The views are gorgeous, the service is impeccable. It’s lovely and warm in the igloos, which is ideal for a colder night.

title: food, cocktails, and views amazing
comment: food, cocktails, and views amazing. this was the highlight of my trip, I fully enjoyed it and after several strong cocktails I slept like a baby in the most comfortable bed.

title: Amazing welcoming!
comment: Not really an usual thing to leave a review but this one totally deserve it! We stayed in London for the Christmas holidays and had breakfast at the Aviary restaurant a few times. We've been warmly welcomed by the host and he took so much care of us during the all week. We never missed of a thing and we received a really good service.  Thank you so much Stephano! We will be back!

title: Great Restaurant
comment: Have been there last night and had an amazing time. The atmosphere was lovely, staff welcoming, food up to expectations. Prior to arrival we called to make a booking and the receptionist Catalin was very professional and very polite. On arrival we where sitted straight away. We were approached by 5 members of staff during our visit, and we felt very looked after. We were served at the beginning by Valerio who paired our meal with a nice wine. Another waitress with glasses the name of which we forgot to ask, was very nice to us, we had a special request and she sorted out in seconds. Then we order the food which was so delicious. Love it there. Will definitely come back very soon!

title: Aviary Igloo
comment: We booked here because we wanted to experience the igloo. Had a great time. The igloos are pricey and they limit you to an hour and a half but we had a great time and it was well worth it.

title: Rooftop bar
comment: A great ambience and a nice views, the staff service was very good. Thanks to bartender Tiago for is fantastic service. I recommend

title: Good once you find it...
comment: It's actually on the top floor of a hotel, but in the dark, hard to find. I walked round the block then rang them up. To my astonishment they didn't know where they were either and struggled to direct me. Woeful. However once actually there and sat down, I have to be honest and say the food and drink were actually good.

title: Amazing Place
comment: I went for the first time in London and randomly went in this restaurant bar which I couldn't find words to say how magical it is! That views, that service was absolutely and I couldn't forget to appreciated the such amazing service that portuguese guy Tiago gave to us! I can not wait to come back! 5*

title: Love this bar
comment: I've been last thursday with my partners of my company on this bar for the first time since we come in London for business. To be honest I was expecting to have so much has we had! We been on the bar enjoying drinks part of the night and we couldn't find any issue on the way we been treated! The who been serving us almost all night names Tiago ( I guess is the right way to write his name ) couldn't be more perfect on his perfect and the way he provide the drinks and the good service for us . This place becomes on of our first option to enjoy a good time next times we come back in London !!

title: Birthday extras
comment: I came to the hotel for my birthday, and I went upstairs for warm breakfast which was extra. Breakfast on the rooftop was so beautiful, customer service was very pleasant and the music was relaxing and calm.  Thank you Irena for being such a fabulous host, Selenia thank you for the loving hot chocolate. Olivier again thank you for making my birthday a lovely treat x

title: Disappointed start but got better
comment: Arrived for a pre-booked table on the first night of our stay at the hotel, we were sat and offered water straight away, however after 15 minutes we still hadn’t been visited to ask about drinks or a food order, at this point I had to go back to the host and ask her to send someone over so we could get some drinks.  This was disappointing given the status of the restaurant and that I had made it clear in the booking notes we were visiting for my girlfriends birthday. However the lady host went straight away to get the manager who came over and took our order straight away. The food was amazing! I had the burger and my girlfriend had the deer, both of which tasted amazing! The drinks were good too, would recommend the knicker bocker cocktail. We were sent out a birthday plate for my girlfriend and 2 glasses of champagne which was a nice touch and made up for the poor start, also we notice on the bill they had taken off the bread and butter we had to start and also one round of our drinks, this wasn’t necessary or expected but made a real impact on us to show the manager cared and wanted to make up for the poor beginning (which both he and his staff did throughout the remainder of the meal).  Thank you and we look forward to going back for another meal next time we’re in the area and will recommend to our friends!

title: Sadly disappointed
comment: In terms of the location and the ambiance of the place, it was fabulous. Got seated at our prebooked table pretty quickly but had a sneaky look out on the terrace which was lovely. However, soon after we were seated and ordered our champanges, a waiter accidentally knocked one of the glasses on our table. The champange dropped onto the chair, coat, jumper and jeans. At the time, the waitress was very apologetic. However, no compensation was offered at the end of the meal which was disappointing. On another note, something that I should have checked prior to booking, the vegetarian options were not incredibly exciting (2 options). It is a shame that this one poor experience has left us disappointed with a place that we had high expectations about. This is probably an isolated incident, but how it was handled was not the customer service we would expect from a higher end restaurant.

title: Amazing!
comment: A wonderful location for our Christmas dinner for a large group of 26. We received fantastic feedback from the team, who loved their meal and night out at the Aviary! Special thanks to Tanya for all her help and hard work in organizing the dinner, she was very accommodating with any changes we had, and made planning the whole event a breeze.

title: Excellent lunch
comment: Had a business lunch here. Views were nice, and i expect are lovely at night. The place was mercifully free of the xmas party crowd and was quite peaceful. Food was lovely and appeared reasonably priced. Would certainly return here.

title: Nice hotel restaurant with great views!
comment: Dined here before heading out to theatre and the booking procedure was very easy via OpenTable. Staff were quick to accommodate and seat us which was great as we had a theatre production to catch in less than 90 minutes! Food came within 10mins of ordering so super fast service and was cooked perfectly with both myself and my partner enjoying our meals. We were then able to enjoy a quick drink whilst overlooking London from the bar outside the hotel which was a nice way to relax and soak in the sights before heading out. If in the area or staying at Montcalm Royal London I would definitely recommend you try this restaurant as you will not be disappointed!

title: Poor Service and no apology
comment: Arrived for breakfast at a pre-booked table. After 40 minutes not all our drinks had arrived (we were waiting for a bottled juice and a cup of tea) and food orders had not been taken so we asked for the bill and departed. I should have checked the bill properly before I paid as the tea was added (and paid for)! Very disappointing, especially for the lack of apology.

title: Stunning Views of the City
comment: The menu is really varied and would suit all tastes im sure. Service was exceptional and the food was very good quality. Add this to the great city views and you will enjoy this palce to eat. I was resisdent at the hotel but im sure its open to non residents too as there was a seperate elevator. The outside terrance is a bonus, its lovley day or night.

title: Social
comment: The spot is great the deal is great And Nejat our waitress is probably the best waitress I have had in years and I have had many extravagant and amazing trios and events. Nejat thank you so much you rock

title: Best Breakfast in town!
comment: My family was visiting and I couldn’t have picked a better place to impress them! Super good breakfast, the food was delicious and the service was absolutely spot-on! Best cappuccino in town! Great atmosphere and view! Can’t wait to go back!

title: Breakfast for champions
comment: London on 1st of January always has a challenge to get good breakfast. We googled and found this little Gem.  Great views and very good buffet spread.  Staff really made an effort with so many Happy New Year wishes. Well managed team. We will return.

title: Fantastic!
comment: First time at this restaurant, perfect location with the restaurant located on the top floor, lovely views of London. The staff very professional, relaxed atmosphere and gorgeous food.

title: Great place - perfect for downtown stay would recommend
comment: I had the pleasure of staying there a few weeks ago whilst in the city for a meeting and everything was to my satisfaction. Amazing amenities as well as a lot of attention to detail. Especially at breakfast when supervisor Oliver was extremely attentive and quick thinking. Would recommend

title: Very expensive Maccy D and fries
comment: I met my dad and cousin in the Avairy Bar for drinks, as they were staying at the hotel, my cousin reserved a table in the restaurant, we had burger and fries, which were extremely expensive. Apart from the burger being cooked fresh, the rest was either from a packet and or frozen, like the fries and not real potatoes.  This was a meal I would pay under £10 in McDonald’s. I definitely won’t be eating here again.

title: Oo la la
comment: Having been to London 4 times and had breakfast buffets, the aviary is by far the best!! The food, continental buffet especially, was delicious!! The view from the roof top was stunning, a lovely morning London view. The staff were so welcoming, funny and friendly; made the visit all the more entertaining. Olivé was especially lovely, kept us entertained our whole meal. Definitely made our visit. Would definitely recommend to all!!

title: Igloo Pods
comment: We visited the Aviary in Royal London House Hotel on Saturday for drinks from 2pm  We were a little late due to traffic but that wasn't a problem as we called ahead.  We paid for the £200 Bronze package that you got a welcome cocktail and nibbles (flatbreads, hummous, olives, almonds. We then had £130 to spend on our tab in the 1.5 hour period. We managed to order some chips & bread/butter for the 6 of us and also a cocktail from the menu. We then had £50 left on our tab but our time was running out, the kind barmaid told us to get a bottle of fizz and she'd let us stay another half hr which was kind of her.  The only thing is they could do with some piped music, it was quiet on the 10th floor of the building.  The weather wasn't that great and was quite cold outside but they have plenty of blankets to keep you warm. Defo worth a visit. Be nice in the summer.

title: Great food and stunning views
comment: Would I go again? Yes So found this place via a google search and was in the area so booked. It's on the 10th floor of a hotel and the views across the city are stunning. We were a small party, and I had the chicken which was so moist and really cooked well. There was a great selection of wine too. The only slight letdown was the service was a little slow (although everyone was friendly) this could be that they had a couple of large Christmas groups i. It wouldn't stop me from going back as the food was very nice - and will try again in the summer when you can sit outside.

title: Nice bar on the 10th floor
comment: A buzzing place this Tuesday evening. Walk in through hotel lobby and they guide you to the lift to the Aviary bar. Shoreditch is an upcoming destination. The bar has a luxurious feel, definitely outside on the terrace with private pods that can be reserved.

title: Igloo with tremendous view
comment: The restaurant is great, the food is amazing and on top of that you get a stunning view over the city. Even if it's day or night it's astonishing, especially lately since they installed some igloo from where you can enjoy the view wile feeling very cozy no matter the weather. Also the stuff is very friendly and professional. They are doing a great job. Thank you Catalin for taking good care of us!

title: Amazing view
comment: The bar is wonderful. We had the best cocktails there and the staff is very friendly. It gets very busy after work and it has a great atmosphere. The terrace is offering one of the best views you can get in London. Thank you Catalin for the hospitality!

title: Great bar and views of London - food let us down!
comment: Brilliant service the staff are very attentive. The ambience was great and the venue feels very special. The views are fantastic and the outdoor terrace despite being winter was a winner and very cosy. The food really let us down I had the burger which was absolutely horrendous! The meat was substandard quality and was not cooked well at all, with the high standard of burgers on offer across London this talked a good game but was a complete let down, I did not finish my meal. Other diners looked to have wonderful meals so perhaps I chose the wrong option. My friend opted for a veggie dish which was also a little bland and not something she would pick again.  Would return but would avoid eating.

title: Great Rooftop
comment: Had lunch at the aviary with a work colleague. The rooftop deck is a gorgeous spot. I recommend it for lunch, or for drinks.

title: Fantastic views across the City of London skyline
comment: You can play count the cranes and you'd run out of fingers and toes.  Really good views; you face from East to South West. fabulous views; really hot on a warm day. Plenty of space outside. Some nice high tables with seats, some sofas and some tables where you can stand. Decent food, decent service. Plenty of seats inside too.  We had some chicken Cesar salads; great meat, big portion for GBP 16

title: Great in the sunshine!
comment: excellent spot for drinks and dinner. The service was superb and food was divine! Little tricky to find but the bright yellow parasols on the balcony give it away!

title: Nice food but...
comment: Went there last night with friends. Food was good but waitress kept pouring large amounts of white wine in my glass despite me asking her not to, hence the wine kept getting warm.  Comment re the bathrooms. In a high end restaurant I would expect there to be nice hand wash and hand cream . Could not fault the food. I had yellow fin tuna to start , COD as a main and cheese board to share for afters.

title: Superb Service and views
comment: We came here for breakfast last Sunday and we absolutely loved it. The service given by the staff that was on that morning was simply spotless since the minute we walked in. We felt so comfortable with the place and and so well looked after at all times that we ended up eating, having more coffee, champagne, etc. We were pleased to have Ali's attention (a lovely guy from Romania we guess he'd be the breakfast manager) at our disposal who guided us well through the breakfast options being friendly and professional at all times. After our breakfast we sat outside enjoying the wonderful views from the open terrace; atmosphere was chilled and staff was always around and on top for anything else we needed. Afterwards we were mainly served by a Spanish chap called Alejandro, who confirmed that the service was still impeccable hours after. Well, I don't think there's much else to add. In a nutshell, fantastic service, atmosphere, views and a great place to go if you are in London. Thank you to all the people there that made our stay a great experience.

title: Good food and views, slow service
comment: We visited this restaurant as a group of four for an evening meal. There is a fantastic roof terrace, drinks are expensive but you are paying for the view. The food was very tasty and made up of fresh ingredients. Some interesting dishes on the menu such as wild deer and hoggett. The service was friendly but quite slow and after ordering initial drinks we did struggle to get the attention of staff at times. We had to ask how long both our starters and mains would be and we did not have time for dessert as a result. I would return for a drink and the view, but would eat elsewhere based on the service.

title: Good view at night
comment: Stopped by for a couple of drinks and to check out the roof top bar. Nice place and quiet inside, busier on the rooftop terrace. Worth it for the views. Although there were loads of people with cameras set up taking pictures which seemed weird.

title: Great view whilst having a drink
comment: Great place for a drink with a view of East London. Would recommend whilst sun is setting. Very beautiful, great service and great selection of drinks. Also offer food but we didn’t eat any.

title: It felt as though they just wanted to shoo us away with awful noise
comment: It felt as though they just wanted to shoo the patrons away. It was our first anniversary and I was so so disappointed with this place. They were playing banging deafening blaring techno music in the bar just across us and my partner and I both ended up with a headache. I had major hopes for this place because of the reviews I read in Timeout. Major letdown. Everything was diluted by the generic god-awful music including the flavours of the food. We couldn't wait to get out of there ASAP. My partner consoled me, but I almost cried because I booked the place for our special moment. The restaurant didn't bother looking at my note on the booking mentioning our special night. You could at least acknowledge why we were there even if you could not honour our special request in the booking? "Coffee/ Dessert, sir/ madam?" It felt like they were being sarcastic with that question.

title: Giresse best waiter ever!
comment: Food was good, service perfect , my waiter was best in Town make sure you come and say hii to him his name is Girrese, any question you ask about food or drinks he always have the answer, he definitely needs promotion! Thank you thank you for making our day even more special ! Highly recommended

title: Lovely Monday
comment: Great place to chill and relax after a day's work..  I'm working here in the city. Many places around to catch up with friends, but I really like Aviary. We came on Monday after work and was quite busy already at 5. Good front of house and bar service!  Recommend it for drinks with a great view.

title: Great View But Hot and Noisy
comment: Office lunch on a hot day. It was extremely hot on the open terrace, great if you like that, but too hot for many. The restaurant is air-conditioned but could not cope with the doors to the terrace being left wide open and as a result was far too hot inside as well. Food was OK, but the sides came long after the mains so you eat the main course then had a further course of side dishes. Hard to hear normal conversation due to very noisy group next to us and who seemed to have had a lot to drink in the sun before coming inside and annoying everyone.

title: Nice setting and beer, but.....
comment: Visited this rooftop bar on a very hot sunny day for drinks with friends.  As it was so hot, i was surpirsed that no shade was provided which meant you had no choice but to sit directly in the sun and roast.  The setting was nice though and you get some lovely views of London.  We tried a beer the waiter recommended called Little Creature (i think)....it was really nice and went down nicely on a hot day. Prices weren't too bad either and the toilets were clean with a grat view! Another strange thing.......it really wasn't busy at all. It was a Sunday afternoon and there were probably 8-10 people in total, seated at about 4/5 tables. The staff then gave us all a 10 minute warning that all the chairs were going to be removed and we could either remain standing or sit on the 'sofa' type seating?  I found this really bizarre? Perhaps on a really busy day, if you want to create more space then do away with the furniture, but not when there are only a few customers sitting down in the glaring sunshine. It was just not necessary?

title: Love it here usually - but not this time.
comment: Sat outside on the roof terrace and had drinks and food in an informal work meeting setting. Two male colleagues and myself (female). Drinks were excellent - food was very good - but the occasion was totally spoilt by the waiting staff calling me "darling" and "love". Not appreciated. I was too polite to mention it but my (male) colleagues asked me how I felt being called "darling" and "love". We all agreed this was not appropriate.

title: Nice staff, lovely place, good views
comment: As the title summarises, the place was lovely. Wasn’t overly busy on a Saturday either. Unfortunately for once it started to rain when we were out on the balcony.

title: Nice place but very noisy
comment: We came for a drink and dinner with my girlfriend. Place was crowded and really noisy and it was Tuesday evening. Our waitress was attentive and helpful, she was taking care of us really well.  Food was really delicious we ordered chicken breast and ribeye steak. Unfortunately the price was quite high 39£ for steak I think it’s a bit to much even the steak was quite simple and portion wasn’t that big but anyway we enjoyed the meal. I really recommend this place but for those who is looking for a quiet and relaxing dinner definitely NOT, bar is just in front of the restaurant area so it was quite difficult even to hear each other while we were taking dinner and talking. We definitely come back in this place again but more for drinks than dinner :)

title: Great service @ Aviary
comment: Just finished our anniversary dinner with my boyfriend at Aviary. Beside the great value food and drinks, I need to mention the great service we have received. Massive thank you Valerio!!! He gave us the the privacy we needed, whilst providing a good old classic service.  Thank you all for making this evening even more special.

title: World Class Customer Service.
comment: The customer experience was great. Knowledgeable and passionate bartender.  I had a special request, Chantel and Feri provided an excellent customer service. Thank you for making my evening and my friend birthday so special. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Mr
comment: Amazing restaurant with delicious food we had seabass wich was perfect and maybe the best chicken ceazer salad ever.Rooftop Terace with amazing view above London city . Staff was really friendly and i will be more than happy to come back

title: Work event on rooftop terrace
comment: Had a wonderful experience at Aviary Bar rooftop terrace. The location and views are spectacular, and the service second to none with staff being professional, courteous, attentive and helpful. Indeed, my experience of all staff, from initial emailing to payment at event close, was 100% positive. The food and drink was delicious! It is expensive but you would expect that in such desirable location. All my colleagues thoroughly enjoyed the evening. I highly recommend this venue and would certainly organise an event here again.

title: Way to Spend Last Day in London
comment: I was in London working on a client project for 6 weeks this summer and my client took me and a few colleagues to Aviary for a long lunch going away. We started on the rooftop overlooking London with a few beers. We dined inside and the starters of king prawn cocktai, hummus, and Padron peppers kicked off a long afternoon of white wine! For my my main, l had the cod which was divine. I ate every single bite. Later we moved to the bar side and enjoyed more wine. Staff is great and the atmosphere gave me a charge!

title: Slow, slow, slow...
comment: We went for lunch to welcome a new member to our team. A two course meal took almost 2 hours! The food was good and the location is fantastic (great views) but the service was slow and inattentive. So much so that I eventually told the rest of our group to head back to the office while I settled the bill. Even then our waiter was in a heated conversation with another member of staff and eventually I had to take the bill over to the cashier to get his attention. This is not a cheap restaurant and the quality of food and location should be supported by better waiting staff. Our office is opposite but we won’t be going back!

title: Great rooftop view
comment: Great rooftop view of the city and outdoor seating. The weather is not your friend and rain will close the terrace but indoor dining is fun and lively. The food and drinks are good but the service can be slow even when they don't seem busy. We ate there for 2 dinners and 1 lunch and I would have to say the service could be better. Not recommended for romantic dining but more for lively bistro gatherings.

title: Wedding party
comment: I was recently invited to a wedding in london and the reception was held in the Aviary roof top bar. It was an amazing experience from start to finish. The decor was fabulous and the view from the roof top was spectacular. The staff had arranged the tables so as we wer looking out over the skyline and and had dressed the room beautifully. We wer greated with glasses of champagne and a very friendly smile by all the staff. Feri one of the members of staff was on hand all day and made sure we wanted for nothing and our server Adriana was also brilliant. The food was outstanding. I couldnt recommend this bar enough. Cant wait to go back!!

title: Birthday meal with my partner
comment: Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The food wasnt amazing but was decent, the presentation was tastier than the actual thing. Service was quite slow though took ages for our food and drinks to arrive, which they apologised for and didnt charge for my partner’s drink and dessert. They put a candle on my dessert which was nice of them. The rooftop is very nice its a shame they close it early, would go again for the rooftop.

title: Review
comment: Been to the Aviary on a beautiful day on the rooftop. Chantal looked after us and was super attentive. Will be here to again if service is typically like this! Thank you

title: Lovely views, not great vibe
comment: I work in the City but have never visited during the week. However my weekend visit didn’t last long: we came for the famous terrace and while it is definitely gorgeous and with a lovely setting, the vibe wasn’t great and we didn’t want to stay long at all. Pass.

title: Review for Chantelle
comment: She’s ace, such an amazing waitress....amazing smile and made our visit! If you ever visit make sure you get her!

title: Great breakfast
comment: Can highly recommend aviary for breakfast, we had a delicious meal and the staff were very attentive - thank you

title: It was OK
comment: Went to the Aviary for lunch today an left at 10pm so i guess it couldn’t have been that bad... food was ok, I’m not massively fussy but I thought for what I paid it could have been better. Drinks were good and barman was lovely but as soon as it got slightly busy they could not cope and waited ages to be served. Staff were ok. Wouldn’t allow us to sit at an area that was “reserved” but the people didn’t turn up (apparently) and then they gave it to some random customers who just went and sat in that area anyway.... even though our group had asked to be seated there. Not too fussed as it was quite windy but service could have been better... oh well.

title: Service poor, poor, poor
comment: Beautiful venue, nice food, just horribly let down by the amateurish service. After arriving and being told the table would be ready in 5mins, we were seated 10mkns later, not a problem. Then sat for 20mins before I asked for our order to be taken...I know this was 20mins as I was getting regular updates from the England football match on my phone. Once our order was placed (Just mains, not starters), we waited a while (30mins) for our food, this was fine as the food was pleasant. What occurred during and after our food was arguably the worst service I have received. The bottle of wine we ordered for the table was topped up once throughout us sitting at the table before the end of our meal. I've no idea if I offended the waiter or if he was just more concerned with the table of 8 behind us. Paid zero attention to us, to the fact that I went to the bar to ask for my bill only to be told to go and wait at my table for our waiter....yay. Alas he did not come so my partner signalled for the manager to get our bill, we waited nearly 10 more mins. At this point the waiter brought the card machine over, threw it to me and turned away. Professional, to the point that I commented....he didn't seem bothered. After I had pressed enter and handed it back to him, he picked up the payment booklet and left, no chance for me to tip (it would have been sparse but would have tipped none the less) Awful service.

title: Amazing views.
comment: Went here for a midday drink with family and it had a great atmosphere. The sunny weather made it a great social place to have a beer!

title: Place with amazing view!!!
comment: If you wanna have a romantic date or just drink with friends I highly recommend this place. The view is breathtaking and cocktails are very good too.

title: Nice view
comment: Been there on a evening. The view is just amazing, recommended to a table on the terrace . Really good drinks. Very professional staff, from bartenders to the waiters. A bit pricey but i would say is worth it.

title: Great view
comment: Went for date night, my partner hoping for a touch of romance......but that didn't happen solely because the place was packed to the rafters, which I suppose for a Thursday night is a good sign (or perhaps it's just because it's London) The staff were pleasant and our server apologised that it was really busy, hardly his fault though. In order to have a conversation we had to sit side by side in between courses, then opposite each other when the food arrived. Nothing that can't be taken in your stride. The food was lovely as was the wine we ordered. My partner ordered steak with fries (which were more like scraps you'd get from the chip shop - only complaint about the food) and I had roast pork loin with dauphinoise potatoes which was delicious. Rhubarb and ginger bombe and chocolate mousse tart for dessert. We didn't get a chance to get out onto the balcony after dinner as there was a little scuffle, which the staff quickly dealt with then they closed the balcony but as we were sat by the vast windows we had a great view over the city which was lovely all lit up in the dark. We would visit again, hopefully with the opportunity to hear ourselves think/chat.

title: A Wonderful Gem in the sky
comment: I took my girlfriend here for a special 30th birthday dinner and it did not disappoint, the venue is incredible with a restaurant sitting high up over London. The food was delicious and very well executed. The service was exemplary, they really couldn’t do enough for you and made a special effort to ensure that everything was right. The food was probably more on the expensive side but not considerably and certainly not for what you got for it. Great value for money, a wonderful reataurant with a rooftop terrace to enjoy a drink on after dinner. Highly recommended, Do Not Miss Out!

title: Excellent views, food/service okay to good
comment: Strong points: - Striking view - Nicely done out - Buzzing even mid-week Weak points: - Food somewhat uninspiring and expensive - Drinks selection limited - Service slightly lackadaisical and occasionally surly

title: Too slow!
comment: Beautiful roof top bar. Service was a shambles. Drinks took 40 mins to arrive when we only wanted a quick drink before rushing of somewhere. Staff ambled around with no urgency whatsoever and no one was actually visibly making any drinks on the roof top bar. On the plus side it was sunny and decor was good

title: Nice place, excellent staff
comment: A really nice first experience at the Aviary bar on this monday Bank Holiday. The rooftop is really nice, stunning view. We had really good drinks. Armand, one of the bartender, helped us to choose which cocktails would perfectly fit with our tastes, and James took a very good care of us, he was really lovely. Thank you guys for this nice experience.

title: Great to Average in one visit!!
comment: Went to Aviary for a Wedding Anniversary lunch with my wife today. Negatives: - No umbrellas /shade on the rooftop - why it was 32c?!?? - made a special request for a table on the terrace online - wasn’t until I called to confirm the booking on the day I was told that this was not possible - Squid in batter with sea bass was the size of a 5p!! And just batter very little/no squid!! - Tables for 2 inside far too close together- we were sitting next to a couple who were having a full on argument & we felt we were part of it too- so awkward/uncomfortable. When your paying more than normal you expect a little space but Aviary keen to pack customers in clearly -Service was so so slow-desserts, which are the quickest to bring out took over 30mins to arrive Positives - Really good vibe - Great city views & lovely terrace - Desserts were worth the wait! - Staff are great- Manager was very sympathetic & the highlight was meeting Giresse whose smile was heart warming & who alone we would come back for!!! Fix the negatives & you’ve got a great restaurant there.

title: Great buzz but they need more bar staff
comment: Lovely vibe and great buzz. Restaurant and bar located on the same floor. There is a distinct lack of bar staff, so ended up waiting an age to get served. Cocktails are pretty average and, as others have said, very pricey for what you get. Food was good, but our ordered was messed up, and we ended up waiting ages for our side dishes. Waiting staff couldn't be any nicer - so helpful and apologetic also when things when askew.

title: London weekend break.
comment: Venue to die for but unfortunately the food was not to the same level. 5 star venue 2.5 star food. Very good service however so overall 3.5 stats.

title: “Great Views, Great Service and Great Food”
comment: Date of Visit: 08.06.18 Review: Having had a long day at a car show we were looking for a place to eat, a few options came to hand but nothing really stood out and by chance we looked up and saw a lot of people on a roof top so headed in that direction and came across the Montcalm on Finsbury Square and lucky we did. Hotel entrance even has some air hockey style games which was a nice surprise and to get to the Aviary you have to go up in the elevator and head to the reception area of the Aviary. You are greeted by a light art deco interior with glass walls and I am told the WC is worth a visit also for the glass walls. Menu was described well and wine paring also done so you get a full fine dining experience. I personally ate the chicken and dessert was shared by all.  Dress Code: Everyone looked smart as some must have come after work in the city but casual is fine as there was dress code stipulated but you may want to just dress up a little as you get some great views on the terrace and makes for some nice photos.  Booking Process: Walk in and they managed to squeeze us in but they were busy so would advice you to book.  Location: 22-25 Finsbury Square , London, EC2A 1DX Decor & Lighting: Decor is Art Deco style but not excessive and pleasant. Light and airy with space between tables so you don’t just feel like a number. Wall to wall glass so lots of light pouring in but was there during daylight so cannot comment on evening light levels.  Heating and Cooling: Perfect temperature, it was a very warm summers day out and nice and airy and cool but not cold inside. Just right.  Ambience & Acoustics: Lively place and busy hence you get the usual crowd noise but although you have to raise your voice a little you can still manage to have a good conversation.  Drinks: The bar was happy to make up a mock-tail although they don’t have any specific ones on the drinks menu which they should consider.  Food:  1. Longhorn beef burger, Montgomery Cheddar, 17.5 maple bacon, tomato relish, onion rings, French fries - Friend had this and said it was ok just a little dry but I cannot comment as I did not try it.  2. Roast fillet of sea bream, seaweed gnocci, 22 clams, samphire, Noilly prat liquor - Another friend had this and was impressed but again I cannot personally comment as I did not try it.  3. Chicken with corn - sorry but they had a new menu so I cannot explain the full dish in detail - Moist and cooked well with a nice base of corn and roast potatoes.  Desert: Keylime tart with sorbet - A nice dessert and really refreshed and cleansed the pallet.  Please note they have a new menu which at the time of writing this (11.06.18) was not on the internet.  Bill / Cost: £120.00 for three Conclusion: Great place to visit and we were very well looked after especially by Feri who was very attentive and offered the best service which really pushed up the score. The only let down would be the staff at the entrance I am afraid as they just did not really seem to care or explained anything to us. However the food, views and all the staff upstairs really made up for the experience. At first there were no tables available but they asked if we can give a table back within 1.5hours so they really tried to accommodate us. Highly recommend this as a place to visit if in the area and easy reach of many stations.

title: Working Lunch
comment: Amazing lunch and cocktails! The Rhubarb Rumble & Raspberry sour is Wonderful staff service. Will deffo be back!

title: Excellent food, view and service!
comment: During a business trip to London, our partner very kindly reserved a table for dinner at this location and it was utterly fabulous! The view is amazing, the food was really good and also the service was good, too!  The only think I didn’t like was that most of the starters are fish which I don’t eat but don’t let that put you off because it is still a great place to visit and eat. Can imagine it’s amazing in the summer!

title: Amazing Time
comment: I came here for bank holiday weekend and it was the perfect ending to a summers day. The security guard Daniel was very nice he looked after us very well and was very attentive. He was professional and very good at his job.  The view is beautiful if you have a camera bring it!

title: Pre booked 18th Birthday celebration
comment: I came here to celebrate with a group of 7 girlfriends. Firstly we were given a very disappointing welcome by one of the security guards, who didn’t greet us, surly a must in a hotel of this standard. He then proceeded to ‘shoo’ - yes ‘shoo’ us away from the lift area because we were not allowed to stand there. So apparently you’re not allowed to stand in front of a lift if you’re waiting for one? I understand we were a large group, but we were careful to make sure we weren’t blocking the thoroughfare. He then made us feel like juvenile delinquents, interrogating us on whether we had a booking, whether or not we were legal to drink, and what name our booking was in. It wasn’t a pleasant way to start the evening.  When we arrived at the restaurant, on the top floor, we had to wait 10 minutes to be seen to our table, with no offer of a seat or drink while we waited, despite booking. Luckily our table waitress was very helpful and accommodating. However, we then had to wait another 55 minutes to receive our main meals (we didn’t order starters), which was appalling. The excuse given was that another large party had to be served before us. Not good enough. The food (when it eventually came) was of an excellent standard though.  Such a shame that the evening was soured by the unfriendly welcome and long wait. This certainly did not appear to be an establishment where 18 year olds are welcomed.

title: Not sunny enough for shorts...
comment: If you fancy wearing shorts on the roof terrace in the city heat then make sure that it’s sunny enough. “Yes sir, you can wear shorts up there, but only when it’s hot like last weekend” was the response that I got by the lift bouncer. I’ll try and arrange the weather better next time!

title: Great views; average cocktails
comment: We visited on a very sunny Friday afternoon. As you'd expect the roof terrace was busy. The views and atmosphere were great, and the service pretty quick for cocktails. The drinks were expensive though (£22+ for a cocktail and a pint), and the cocktails were distinctly average - you do pay for the location!

title: lovely lunch and fantastic staff
comment: my friend and I went for lunch and sat outside. We had very attentive staff and food/drinks came out pretty quickly. the food is a little pricey and you don't get much of it but because we had such a nice experience we didn't mind. we got there around 12 ish and didn't leave until around 16:30 as it was such a lovely atmosphere . Our bill was around £150 but we had a bottle of wine, 4 cocktails, 2 mains and 2 sides so i suppose that's reasonable?

title: amazing food and service
comment: amazing views outdoor rooftop friendly staff nice ambience  good cocktails busy place desserts are my favourite here so keep plenty of room for these.

title: Worth it for the view
comment: Beautiful views in London.. has a very New York style rooftop to it. Drinks are delicious and service was prompt. Will definitely return for an after work cocktail..

title: Great venue
comment: Started with drinks at the bar, which had a lively buzz about it and pleasant staff. This was followed by a lovely meal in the restaurant which had a relaxed atmosphere and great food. Our waitress Benedetta was attentive, but not intrusive, keeping our glasses topped up and making recommendations when asked and generally looking after us very well. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Lovely views, great venue for drinks
comment: I had been to Aviary for drinks before and had a great evening so we decided to bring some colleagues here for lunch. It is a lovely venue with great views of the City making it a good spot to point out iconic buildings to our visiting colleagues. The restaurant was very quiet which was great as we had a lot to discuss. My colleagues had the mussels which they enjoyed. I ordered the cod but unfortunately there was none left of so I opted for the pork neck which was good but the cabbage tasted strongly of oil. The service was also very slow considering there were so few people in the restaurant. Possibly it was just an off day for the team as I know other people have had a great lunch here.

title: Great Night Out
comment: We have eaten at the Aviary on several occasions. The views of London are great and we recently held pre-wedding drinks & dinner here. Our guests loved the Aviary. They cater very well for dietary requirements and the food is reasonably priced. We can't wait to go back. It gets busy in the evening so we recommend making a reservation.

title: Christmas Do
comment: Bit late doing the review but nonetheless, great place for our works Christmas do. Lovely rooftop bar, nice touch to have people greeting you from the elevator. Would go back.

title: Amazing rooftop bar!
comment: Been there many times already. Great location and very good service. Coat check available if needed.

title: Good food and fun atmosphere
comment: Food is good and they offer gluten free options. Our server was polite and had fun interactions with the kids. The view is also enjoyable. My youngest son was interested in all the stuffed birds and one of the staff was kind enough to lift him up to checkout the birds closely. They do not have many kid friendly menu options.

title: average rooftop bar
comment: a very average roof top bar not enough seating and also the drinks are pretty pricey. its not that high up so doesnt even feel special as views arent exactly amazing! very good atmosphere though..

title: Birthday
comment: Average. Average. Average. Would never go here again for food only the bar was good! So expensive for such average quality. Not impressed.

title: Dinner booking
comment: An amazing dinner at Aviary. Excellent service and simply divine food. We both had the short rib beef, cooked perfectly. Followed by desert which my wife described as the best she has ever had.

title: Great birthday meal !
comment: Took my friend here for her 25th birthday and the food was very good and the service was great. Tables were a little too close together but it was a beautiful venue with great views, would definitely recommend

title: Amazing place
comment: Very nice atmosphere, friendly staff, great views from the terrace, delicious food and great cocktails. Love it!

title: Decent food, service curiosity
comment: I stayed at Montcalm for a few weeks in December 2017. The daily breakfast is at Aviary which is an adequate buffet but is a little lacking in variety. The fruit is the same every day and I never saw a banana offered even though I was there for three weeks. Still there were a lot of other buffet options so overall not bad. My one issue is you just could not get them to ever come over to offer you a second coffee, you literally have to chase them down or wave them over to ask for a refill. Meanwhile the servers would congregate near the coffee station. Very odd almost as if they didn't want you to have that second cup. They should set up a self service for drip coffee so you don't have to chase them. Other than this odd quirk the breakfast there is good.

title: Cocktails on the roof terrace
comment: We checked into the Royal London house early and were told about the roof top bar. It was a lovely sunny day warm enough to sit outside minus coats. The rhubarb rumble was delicious. We ordered some tapas and spent a leisurely 2 hours eating and drinking.The male bar tenders were fun friendly and mixed a delicious array. We returned to reception where our keys were waiting and cases had been delivered to our room We returned late evening to have a night cap to find it was busy inside with a nice vibe

title: Wonderful views
comment: The Montcalm Royal London in my opinion is the best place to stay whilst visiting London, the Aviary is amazing, the views are the best. We have visited maybe 6 times and different times of the day and we are never disappointed, there is normally some sort of entertainment on throughout the day/night. It’s a definite must visit place if your in Shoreditch

title: Nice diner night
comment: I had a great time there,the food is simply amazing and the atmosphere is just great.Many thanks to Catalin witch make our evening special.

title: Good for after work drinks and cocktails - With Views of London
comment: It could be a little pricey for drinks but that is not surprising for a rooftop style bar/ restaurant in London.  You may want to make a reservation during the summer months as it gets very busy.

title: Great views
comment: I went to the Aviary for some after work drinks. It's a great venue, very good service and brilliant views. There is outside space which I didn't sit in as it was cold but I would love to visit again in warmer weather.

title: Excellent breakfast/Wonderful evening drink
comment: The Aviary is somewhere everyone nearby or staying at the hotel shoudl try. It doesnt dissapoint at any time, but breakfast and dusk are particularly great moments.

title: Dinner
comment: We had a memorable meal with excellent service. The chestnut soup was outstanding. The food was first rate and well presented.  The view from the restaurant and terrace was wonderful. I like the igloo pods which allowed you to stay outside in colder weather. Outstanding

title: Very Impressed
comment: The views from Aviary are worth visit alone. The cocktails are brilliant and the bar staff are more than happy to provide off menu/classic/non-alcoholic cocktails. The food was amazing. Oysters, ordered at 9.30pm, were perfect (This should tell you all you need to know really, they know what they're doing and they do it well.). The steak was cooked exactly as ordered, chips were fantastic. Dessert was wonderful. The staff were so friendly and exceptionally busy. The ONLY fault I can find is that we had to wait 20/30 minutes to order, but this was because every table was full and there was a very large group in. And I was hungry... Otherwise they would get 5*.

title: Good food in a special, memorable setting
comment: This is a roof top restaurant with an adjoining bar which has a large heated terrace overlooking the London skyline. The views from the terrace and also from the restaurant/bar (which has floor to ceiling windows) really are quite special. To celebrate a special occasion, we enjoyed a late lunch at the Aviary with a medium sized group. Both the service and food were good, but some of the dishes these could have been improved. For example, the slow braised Longhorn short rib with Dauphinoise potatoes was delicious, but could have included a seasonal green vegetable rather than this being an additional side order. Similarly, the Smoked ham hock terrine starter with pineapple chutney only came with a few shavings of Lincolnshire poacher cheese, some water cress and a thin crisp. This could easily have been complimented with a pickle of some kind and a slice of fresh bread. It was similar with the soup. A side order of bread at £4 seemed a little excessive. With the exception of a steak (too rare for preference when ordered as medium rare, returned but then too well done so not charged to the bill - thank you) all of the dishes were felt to be delicious. Service was attentive and good, but then the restaurant and bar were quiet at the time.  We left happy, feeling that Aviary was a good choice and a memorable venue for a special occasion lunch.

title: Stunning Food, Service and Cocktails!
comment: Stunning Food, Service and Cocktails! I had the Sweet Potato Soup for starters, so flavoursome, a great surprise! I then had a main from the specials, Bacon Chop, which was equally tasty! These were washed down by one of the signature cocktails, 'Take it Sloe' which although only small, packed a stunning punch and was well worth the £12.50!

title: Great location, great food, Veganuary champions!!!
comment: After taking on Veganuary, my wife and I strived to find a restaurant that would accommodate our special first anniversary dinner. Cauliflower steak was definitely a winner. Service was very attentive, even a mini dessert with “congratulations” in chocolate on. Nice touch Kim, thanks.

title: Very Disappointing Customer Service Spoiled The Evening ...
comment: The restaurant was very noisy, as it's situated alongside the bar. A large group of people were celebrating near us and it wasn't possible to hold a normal conversation.  The starters were good (we had terrine) and then steaks, which were also good. The waiting staff were variable, one waitress knocked my chair several times, without apologising, whilst rushing to attend to the large party. My partner inadvertently knocked over a glass of red wine (not an issue, just an accident) and the waitress came to help him mop his jacket, which was splashed, however she completely ignored me and the wine had stained my coat, my silk scarf and my suede bag. She totally disregarded me and never offered me any help. I was disgusted to be treated in such a manner and was very upset. The manager came over and apologised for my treatment, she offered to pay for my coat to be cleaned. However by then I simply wanted to go home. The cynic in me wondered whether my partner got the attention because he booked the table and was paying the bill.

title: Lovely little rooftop
comment: Came here for a late night drink with a friend and decided to sit outside, despite the freezing cold weather. The waiter service outside was very slow which is almost understandable but it could've just been self service! Drinks as expected but mostly great for the views. Would be amazing in summer but I imagine seriously busy!

title: Cold but cool
comment: Popped in for a Sunday lunch and then stayed to watch the sun go down. I normally don't enjoy roast dinners in restaurants as I normally (and arragontly) feel that I could do better myself. this one however was spot on; generous portions, well cooked beef, good roast potatoes and a lovely gravy. Service in both the bar and the restaurant was spot on.  Even though it was cold outside we still happily sat out and enjoyed the view while sipping a selection of excellent whiskies.

title: Brilliant dinner, great view, amazing service
comment: I came here with my partner on a Thursday night for dinner, she's gluten free so we are very careful about telling the waiter about her intolerance. A young geordie chap called James served us, he was great, he helped us navigate the menu with ease. my partner had a soup and i a special pigeon dish, both were excellent. we followed with a chateau to share, Amazing meat and great sauces one in particular was a blend of Marmite and Hollandaise (a amazing idea for a marmite fan like me) we finished with a cheesecake to share and a couple of G&T's. Perfect service from a chap that really knew his stuff and great food.

title: Loved everything about it!
comment: Booked Aviary for a special occasion and they definitely made it special. Food was gorgeous: we had a salmon tartare with a hint of spice and some creme fraiche that was just perfection. The venison we had after that was so unexpectedly satisfying (cream, lemon and venison was something I never thought of). Service was spot on - friendly yet not intrusive. We felt very welcome. Had a couple of cocktails to round up our meal, the sloe gin cocktail is definitely a must try.  We will be back :)

title: Great for drinks
comment: Spent an evening here in sept with friends just for drinks, great view and good atmosphere drinks normal London prices so not cheap. But still lovely drinking spot obviously enjoyed when weather is good

title: Beautiful Evening
comment: We had come to London to watch England play Argentina for my 60th birthday treat and my daughters had booked a meal here for all six of us.The views were amazing and the food just as good. Staff were great and we had a lovely evening here, thank you so much.

title: Thank you Pierre
comment: We visited this restaurant after reading some great reviews.. The service was friendly and welcoming from the moment we walked in. We ordered two Sunday dinners. We gave some honest feedback. Pierre was excellent. He took feedback on board and went out of his way to make our experience a good one. He really went the extra mile.

title: Beautiful
comment: Such a nice view great drinks with my Sis. Get under the outdoor heated and plenty of blankets. Bar staff were good and recommended drinks. A good place for a selfie.

title: Absolutely loved it!
comment: Went there a couple of weeks ago with my daughter. We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We got to enjoy a drink at the bar before going to our table. We were looked after by Marianne who was very nice to us - she explained the menu and made some great recommendations. We both had the cod with a side of chips to share. The fish was very fresh and tasty. We were recommended a bottle of Rioja that was also very nice. We tried the cheesecake and the chocolate cake with some great dessert wines. Altogether, an amazing evening. Would definitely go back and recommend :)

title: Big disappointment
comment: Christmas dinner, food very disappointing, not much of it plus brought to the table luke warm. Staff friendly but very disorganised and unprofessional , sitting plan which was forwarded before was all wrong. Drinks spilled by the staff and at the end the dinner issue with the bill which was overcharged. The igloo experience not worth trying either, very flimsy structure, and long wait for the drinks. Overall very disappointing

title: Distinctly average Christmas dinner
comment: The food wasn't great. The butter was frozen, the smoked trout was tasteless and the Christmas pudding was very dry. The dry pudding wasn't helped by the smallest serving of brandy custard. On the plus side, the turkey and trimmings were good. So overall, I wouldn't recommend this place for a Christmas dinner. For the price you are paying, you can get far fayre better elsewhere.

title: Great food but service was slow!
comment: Visited here for a Birthday meal on a Saturday. Food very good! Menu is varied but could do with adding a few more sides - paying £6 for some "mixed leaves" which consisted of rocket and spinach leaves wasn't worth the money. Desserts were delicious and the views, even in the dark is a definite selling point!  The downside for us was that the service left a lot to be desired and the staff were not very attentive. Had to ask to order drinks and food. We'd ordered a bottle of wine that was poured then stored in the corner.... we had to keep asking for a refill. I didn't think it justified the 12.5% service charge, especially as it wasn't exactly heaving!  Overall though, a good visit.

title: Good food, great location
comment: Very nice rooftop restaurant and bar with amazing view from the large terrace. The restaurant gets very loud and it’s difficult to speak to your guests though. Service is good but steaks take long time. Always crowded - reservation is a must

title: Unbelievable views
comment: Amazing bar. I love the music they play - I couldn't get any of it on shazam as its a mix tape but a mix of classics with light house music, creates a great atmosphere.  Bar service or waitress service is available. The outside seating areas are well thought out with comfy chairs and in colder days they offer blankets so you can still sit out and enjoy the views of the city. I love this bar - I would have stayed sitting there all weekend if I was allowed!

title: Special
comment: Aviary, is a wonderful restaurant with great views and a great atmosphere. The staff go above and beyond. I asked for a special night to propose to my partner, and they pulled out all the stops reserving us a wonderful area on the terrace, a nice spot in the restaurant, and with all the extra little special touches.  Thank you for making it a special evening, and special mention to all the staff who helped within the restaurant that evening and to Marie O'Connor who set it all up beautifully, including organising rose petals, and Prosecco in the room on our return. Also of note, we returned the following day for a drink in the daytime and they put on entertainment, with a very talented singer providing a great atmosphere in the daytime too.

title: Lovely meal
comment: Really enjoyed the food and drinks. The atmosphere was nice and welcoming not too intrusive. I had the burger which was delicious and the house salad. The cheesecake to finish was delicious.

title: Delicious food, wonderful views, excellent service
comment: As a vegetarian, I am used to being able to make a choice quickly due to the limited veggie options available on menus. The main choice was whether to have a salad or risotto: as it was a chilly evening, I chose the risotto. My omnivore partner had a wide choice and took his time. The Jerusalem artichoke and almond soup was delicious and I would definitely recommend this to anyone eating here. Prawn cocktail was the other starter, it may have had only one prawn, but it was large, juicy and lovely to eat. My partner thoroughly enjoyed his main of chicken. I was vaguely concerned about ordering the risotto as, I feel, risotto shows, lack of imagination. How wrong I was THIS risotto was full of flavour, the almonds added to the texture of the dish and my previous prejudice about this meal was totally unfounded. Have not fear, veggies, this meal is one to savour and enjoy. We both chose blackberry cheesecake which completed a wonderful meal. The staff were welcoming and attentive without being intrusive.

title: Good food but service needs to improve
comment: The food was good but the service needs to be addressed as some of the staff appear not to have received sufficient training. A Manager recognised the problem and was apologetic and promptly gave us a glass of Proseco. Not the place for a quiet dinner as the music is playing for the people at the bar.

title: Terrible
comment: Terrible evening. As we entered the restaurant my girlfriend got knocked over by a security guard pushing her out of the way to get upstairs. Then we were met by no one to take us to our seat so we walked around aimlessly trying to find someone who actually worked there.  As we were eventually seated no one came to our table to take our order, and in the end we had to ask a cocktail waitress to take our order who had no clue what to do or say.  Food was very expensive, tiny portions and not particularly good considering the price and service was poor.  Overheard other customers complaining about food and service.  Manager who was dressed inappropriately was behaving unprofessionally talking and laughing as if no customers were in sight.  Heard staff arguing and complaining to one another in plain sight for us all to see.  Would not recommend and would not go back.

title: Stunning London views & great food
comment: My partner and I booked this as a treat for one of our last nights out in London, and it didn’t fail to impress! From the warm welcome from the staff to the stunning nighttime views from the terrace, we had a great evening.  We ordered Scallops (unfortunately arrived cold but tasted incredible!) and the special Pheasant ravioli for starters and for mains we had red deer and Haggot (we had to google this!), which were also delicious!  I’d highly recommend the Honey Rider cocktail too, so tasty I had two! Just a little watch out for the G&T lovers out there... the tonic they serve tasted so unusual (apparently its a ‘herby’ version) I didn’t even think it was a G&T!  Overall a great night and would highly recommend a visit here either with friends or as a romantic night out.

title: Excellent restaurant for a birthday - amazing views
comment: We came here for a friends birthday at the end of October. I was much more impressed with the place and the menu than i was when i looked at it on line. Its in a great location - for us we all live in Essex so being only 5 mins from Liverpool Street was a real bonus.
