The place is stunning - the views are amazing i only wished we'd got there a little earlier to enjoy and cocktail outside on the roof terrace. The food was amazing - there was something for everyone on the menu and it wasn't too fussy either. Price was good for what you got and the ambience but it wasn't cheap. I will be going back and i would recommend it anyone who likes good food and nice places. Hidden gem in London.

title: Lovely!
comment: I had a great experience here last Saturday night! The staff were very friendly and helpful and continued to check everything was alright throughout the meal. The food was delicious! Unfortunately they had ran out of the starter I wanted, but the waiter helped me choose something else based on what flavours I like. I was not disappointed. The food was perfectly cooked and tasted delicious. If you are taking your parents for a nice meal, or fancy treating yourself with a friend or partner I would recommend the Aviary!

title: You're paying for the location - and not the food, the drinks and the service!
comment: Went here for a birthday brunch. There were eight of us and we'd already ordered in advance (as they'd asked us to), but they'd changed the menu since we ordered just two weeks before, so there was lots of faffing regarding certain meals having to be changed.  When the food arrived, three of the eight dishes were wrong (e.g. salmon instead of bacon with eggs) but it had taken so long to get the food, we decided not to send anything back!  Drink orders took 10-15 minutes to arrive, even when we were ordering wine. This sort of delay would acceptable on eight cocktails as they would have to be made, but not on wine. Apparently, each order just gets added to the bar list, so we were waiting behind someone else's cocktail order.  The staff were very pleasant, but were prickly when we commented about the wait. I got the feeling they deal with people complaining a lot - because the set up just isn't working.  The view from the rooftop was lovely. The venue felt very opulent. But make no mistake, this is what you're paying for.

title: Beautiful Location, Nice Drinks, Nice Menu
comment: My fiancé and I had a great experience at Aviary. The restaurant is simply amazing, nice decor, beautiful view. Truly a great experience. The cocktail list is outstanding and we really enjoyed all the drinks we had. Food was very good and fresh. The only thing I enjoyed less was the sirloin. It wasn't tender, I wouldn't recommend it. Aurore gave us a great service. Thank you!

title: Super venue, lovely views, food ok
comment: I went here for lunch with some colleagues from work one Monday lunchtime. This is a high end (but not elite) restaurant which is perfect for business lunches where you want to be at a pleasant venue. The main thing about the location is the view - placed on the top of the Royal London Hotel in Finsbury Square, you get lovely views all around, and particularly across to the South and East toward the skyscrapers off the City. The venue makes the most of it but being enclosed in lots of glass so you can enjoy the view from the comfort of your table. But when the weather permits, they've got a nice outside terrace where you can enjoy a glass or two. Staff were friendly and attentive. The menu was good, but I think I got a bit unlucky with my steak which turned out to be full of thought blood-vessels and I had to leave about a third of it. Pros 1. First rate views of the City 2. Bright and modern rooftop venue Cons 1. It's pricey - £11 for a G&T! 2. My personal experience of the steak was poor - so food might be patchy

title: Perfect Private Event..
comment: We hosted a private party in the Glass Box area at Aviary, in celebration of a special occasion, and enjoyed a wonderful night! Gintare, Nick and the team ensured the event went off seamlessly so that we and our forty guests enjoyed a fabulous evening filled with plenty of bubbly, delicious cocktails, and some lovely nibbles. We were blessed by good weather and the skyline view at sunset from the terrace was beautiful. We also had an excellent view of an unrelated fireworks display towards the Thames!  At night the venue has a bit of a New York/art deco vibe about it. The overall atmosphere was relaxed, with just the right amount of glamour and party buzz about it. My thanks to everyone at Aviary who helped make the party such a success. I highly recommend the venue!

title: Great roof terrace! Amazing views over London!
comment: I popped into the Aviary with a group of friends, as one of our friends brother was DJ'ing on the roof bar/ terrace.  The entrance and interior is of a fancy London outset and looks great. It was busy and if we hadn't been invited, we'd have had to wait a while to get up to the roof bar.  A quick lift ride later, you're on the roof. There's a centre bar serving all your drinking needs. It's not the cheapest place in London but nor is it the most expensive. If you didn't mind paying average to higher end London prices then you wouldn't be coming here in the first place! It's an upmarket atmosphere but casual at the same time. I think a pint of beer is about £6. I bought a round (5 people) of beers and a glass of vino for the lady and it came in at under £40, which I thought was okay. Friendly and helpful staff. Great music (not that I'm biased) but most importantly, the views over central London were amazing! Great place to have an evening drink!  In all, I thoroughly enjoyed the place and would certainly go back and recommend it to others.

title: Excellent food
comment: Excellent breakfast and very good atmosphere in the evenings. Very nice terrace with an amazing view.

title: Good London views
comment: Not the largest London Hotel bar but it has good views and plenty of seating arrangements either at the bar or around by tables.  There is a balcony looking back towards The City which is obviously the popular place to sit and drink.  Staff are friendly and helpful, security staff look smart in their suits as do the bar staff and waiters. Would drink here again and hopefully pick a time when we can get a seat outside.

title: Cracking bar on top of a cracking hotel
comment: Excellent, brilliant views, modern and comfortable vibe, well stocked and brilliantly staffed by knowledgeable and friendly people. Music is good and not OTT, and of course the lovely Montcalm is underneath if you decide not to travel home..

title: Well saved!
comment: I've been to the Aviary a few times, and never had any issues, actually I adore their french fries. In my opinion, restaurants should be qualified or reviewed in many ways, food, service, hygiene, atmosphere, etc. But what really makes a difference is how do they react when something didn't go as it was supposed or something has been served wrongly. We went for lunch to celebrate my cousins birthday on Sunday, we were 10 people but did a reservation for 7, they had no problem on finding a way to adapt to the situation by kindly adding new seats and tables to it (which I can assure you it is NOT very common in London City). Also, there was a little problem with my dish and they solved it very quickly and they also gave us lovely desserts for free as an apology (insert a LOVE emoji here)! + Amazing views. Will go back for sure.

title: Great food and great views of London
comment: We visited last night and I have to say we were not disappointed. The food was delicious and full of flavour. The scallops were amazing. The only sour point I would say is the service which was very slow. Our starter came out before our drinks. We had to keep asking for our drinks. The outside terrace was great. Beautiful views of London.

title: Amazing
comment: Great drinks, amazing view - perfect afternoon looking over London with friends. Staff were really friendly

title: Amazing City view in a beautiful hip setting
comment: We had a somewhat odd/lucky introduction to Aviary as we ended up eating dinner with one of the owners across the street at The Sichuan (amazing food, read my review) and he very sweetly offered to walk us over to take a look. As he had promised, the view is astounding. The height is perfect and the aspect - facing the river and the crazy new City skyline is quite something. Access is quick and easy (unlike some of these rooftop places). It was a FRIGID night so we just hung out on the terrace for awhile. They have the clear plastic heated igloos for groups and that would be the way to go on these cold nights. We befriended a couple who had snagged a spot under a heater on one of the comfy outdoor couches and extended our time a bit. The interior space is gorgeous and posh with a restaurant on one side and a lively bar on the other. We hung out in the bar for awhile - a classy area with hip but comfortable Mid Century Modern furniture. The bartenders and drink options are excellent and despite our somewhat tatty appearance (compared to a posh holiday party crowd) in down jackets, etc we felt welcomed and well taken care of. Again the view, which you get from extensive window coverage in the bar/restaurant, is the bomb. I can only imagine hanging out on the terrace in the spring/summer as the sun is going down, sipping a nice cocktail and hope to experience that on a return visit.

title: Not so much
comment: They say that if your food is over salted the chef is in love....well our chef was clearly head over hills for someone. My linguini was extra salty....so was my sister-in-laws cod. The stake was very average....and all of that took about an hour to get to our table, considering there was barely anyone in the dinning room when we ordered. Also, to add to unpleasantries, one of the water glasses had someone's lipstick on it, probably didn't get washed, the waiter didn't notice and poured water into it anyways...a little bit embarrassing for me, since the restaurant was my choice and invite for the group.  The patio for drinks was a much better experience

title: Nice and convenient - great terrace overlooking Fins Square
comment: We had a Dairy cow sirloin and a skate. The food is good but not outstanding. The best part was the cocktail on the terrace on a warm summer evening. Really relaxing - for guests of the Montcalm its the best thing to do on short notice.

title: Few drinks with a view
comment: Went for drinks and snack food with friends and family to try something different. It was a nice restaurant with friendly staff. Drinks a bit on the expensive side.

title: Dessert
comment: Very nice place to enjoy a sunny day, we had order 2 chocolate fondants.A little mistake happen but the staff from Aviary were carefully and solved everything in short time.

title: Disappointing
comment: Pros: Great views and attentive waitress  Cons: This breakfast/brunch place is really only dedicated to hotel guests. We arrived having made a reservation and rather than being taken to a table we were left to wander and find one for ourselves. The food arrived cold and had to be sent back as it was not what we ordered. Best ordering from the buffet rather than the a la carte.

title: Great Service, Delicious Food and Fantastic View.
comment: Excellent food and service. Catalan made our experience the best ever. He overheard it was my birthday and went out of his way to make it special. Thank you Catalin.

title: Beautiful brunch on rooftop terrace with a view! :)
comment: We have been in the Aviary rooftop bar in the last week of August. Before our arrival I have phoned the venue and asked whether we need a reservation, they said no and when we arrived there - we have been kindly escalated to the table with no problems. The interior design is nice, looks like a mix of styles with a look-back to 60's in the lounge area and a bit more classy in the restaurant area. The bar is just in the middle and you can walk around it which is very convenient. Between 2 of us for our brunch we had the following dishes: * Raw fish sashimi * Linguini with king prawns * Original cider My husband absolutely loved the sashimi dish, even though he is not a massive fan of raw food but as we were in Aviary for the very first time, he wanted to give it a go and see how it is gonna be :-) He loved it!... The dish came in a long plate in a shape of a boat, inside there were brown stones and on the top of stones slices of raw fish, salmon, tuna etc. It looked very nice and unusual, it made us think about the sea right away as the presentation reminded us "a boat full with fish"- interesting approach! :) I had avocado linguini with king prawns and I absolutely loved that dish! It came very well-seasoned, not spicy but some zest of chilly which added to a nice flavour, pluscolourful baby tomatoes and well-grilled prawns- very delicius and wel-presentable dish. Cannot fault it for nothing really. We were pleased with our brunch there which topped our meal with a nice original cider. Afterwards, we went to the rooftop terrace and sit outside on cosy sofas, having a refreshing drinks, listening to relaxing music and enjoying a very sunny day over London :) It was a very warm and beautiful day so the whole experience was very nice and enjoyable, we are happy that we have chosen this place for our time out together and we have been one more time to Aviary since, this time with our friends.  On a rainy day, of course, it is less spectacular as you will need to sit indoors... I think this place will give you most of it on a sunny and warm day rather then be a good shelter in the bad weather.

title: Gorgeous meal
comment: We were staying in the hotel so wondered up for dinner and were not disappointed. A beautiful meal. Competent attentive staff who were helpful in explaining what my celiac partner could/couldnt eat.  Would recommend

title: A mixed experience
comment: As I was staying in the Montcalm RLH Hotel, this is their main venue on the roof top. The restaurant is well appointed, spectacular views across London and during the day is a pleasure to be at, and the roof top terrace is awesome, quiet and great to visit.  Night time the terrace is packed, too many smokers and not much fun at all, my suggestion is to avoid it at night. There are queues to the lift, and then even when you get upstairs there is then another queue to actually get outside.  The restaurant though is lovely, as are most of the staff. The hostess/management are a mixed bag as well. Thanks to Olivier for checking up on me and taking the time to notice I was there a lot. Food was really good, try the 'retired dairy cow' steak, and ensure you get the explanation of what exactly it is...odd experience for sure. Great sides, thoroughly enjoyed desserts, and really did not find the food prohibitively expensive at all. Give it a look for dinner, read the bar review separately.

title: Terrace with a great view
comment: I chose this restaurant specially for a friend who would enjoy the view - despite knowing the city well, he'd never seen it from this angle which is really impressive. The food was good - chateaubriand with sides being the main attraction - but the wine list was a bit uninspired. Would like to have seen a wider selection. Staff were attentive and discrete.

title: Great view, venue and restaurant
comment: We visited the bar and restaurant for an early evening drink and meal. The views were spectacular and the bar/patio service was fine given the number of people that were there that night. The food menu had a good choice and the service was very good. Great meal and nice choice. Would definitely go back.

title: Beautiful venue, excellent service
comment: Having heard about Aviary in a Timeout article, it didn't disappoint. I booked a table for breakfast, not knowing what to expect. Aviary is part of the hotel below, and where guests have breakfast from a buffet or select from the menu. The buffet was excellent, with a choice of continental or hot buffet with great choice. The service was excellent and the manager was very attentive. After food, we sat outside on the rooftop for coffees and teas which was beautiful. Would definitely recommend for breakfast and I imagine its beautiful in the evening with views across the City.

title: Very classy
comment: The first time we had been here and it was only for coffee, but what a nice place! A rooftop bar and terrace with plenty of space, very friendly staff, and a decent atmosphere. And, given the location, the prices were entirely reasonable. Well worth a visit.

title: Good breakfast
comment: Stayed at the hotel and had the buffet reataurant. The quality of the food was great and the range ok with juice pastries and good cooked options. Place was quiet at 8.30 on a sunday morning and some of the staff didn't seem happy. Wasnt able to eat outside even though its not busy. No explanation given. A shame as the views of london from the roof are stunning. Recommend for breakfast as i thought £22 for a sizeable buffet selection was good value.

title: Great view, great food, amazing cocktails!
comment: Went there for dinner and drinks, the roast chicken I ordered was delicious!!! I had this cocktail called "high heels society", it was AMAZING! With their beautiful 360 views of the city of London, what a place to be at for drinks and catch up with my friend. Highly recommend!

title: Newly refurbished but potential to be a gem
comment: My team went here for our team Christmas lunch last year. It was still being refurbished which was a little odd, as they had opened anyway. However, you can tell it will be a great venue and the food and service did not disappoint. I have heard great things from friends and colleagues who have visited lately, so I am keen to return in the near future.

title: Chilled Sunday
comment: My friends and I had our eyes on this place for a while and we managed to pick a Sunny day for it.  The restaurant looked stunning, open and bright. The staff were helpful and polite which is always a bonus. The food was delicious, honestly could not fault it. I purposely made sure I picked something different to my friends, just so I could try theirs so I new what to get on my next visit.  I had the lobster and crab role with fries and I have to say it was delicious but a small portion.  The view from the rooftop bar is nice but I've had better views at other rooftop bars. But still, it was a nice vibe and good alcohol.

title: Great view but expensive
comment: We went on a Friday evening and had drinks at the rooftop bar. It was busy but had no problem getting served. Good view over the city and a great atmosphere. Very interesting cocktail list however in end we all went for fairly basic drinks (v&c, r&c etc). I wasn't particularly watching the drinks being made up and both my friend and myself were taken aback as the spirits seemed to be large measures - surely this should not happen unless requested.  Prices were outrageous though - £45 for 4 drinks (one a soft drink only!). 3 mixer bottles opened but half of each kept behind the bar, surely at least one could have been split across 2 drinks? Nice for a one-off visit but unlikely to be back.

title: Great rooftop, good drinks, questionable taste levels
comment: This is a pleasant spot for rooftop drinks in fine weather. Prices are high, but what do you expect? Bartenders are friendly, relatively knowledgeable. Warning: much of the crowd seems to come via Liverpool Street station, so not exactly a local Londoners’ spot. The one thing that has flummoxed me: on one warm day a friend and I showed up nicely dressed, but in shorts. We were warned by a security type that shorts are not allowed—but that this time he would let us in. “Just for future reference.” This is absolutely laughable, for several reasons. Many patrons of this place display vulgar taste, even if not wearing men’s shorts. I spotted one man wearing ripped jeans so tight I could absolutely discern his religion. On a previous occasion, there was a gaudy hen party in the house, complete with tacky sashes and phallic drinking straws. How is this considered tasteful and the sight of my legs (nicely toned, if I do say so myself!) not? Many women in the venue wear outrageously tight and short skirts. What’s with the double standard? I like this place because of the open air ambiance and decent cocktails, but any aspirations to being a “classy joint” are a joke. Free the male leg from this injustice!

title: Overcrowded Bar bad service
comment: Although it was Friday night which Is busy they let us in after 30 minutes wait  Rooftop bar supposed to have great view but private party so not possible see view Waited long time bar - bartender unprofessional unlike in the USA Served a group which came after us and a young woman ahead of us  Argued that woman was ahead of us incorrect  Only after we called manager did we get service Overpriced cocktails very noisy  Overly crowded in terrace impossible get in

title: Bubbles on the rooftop
comment: My friend and I came here for an early dinner and even though all seats were taken the friendly waiters gave us a reserved table given we would be quick. Really great spot with wonderful views of London. The food was very nice, the service was great and the champagne was cold. Two thumbs up.

title: Food not up to standard - badly organised - very expensive
comment: This is the first time that I have written a bad review on here but I would avoid this restaurant if possible. We visited on Friday night having pre-booked because we were staying at the hotel. It was extremely busy but fair enough - although we were told probably 3 or 4 times that we could only have the table for 2 hours. That's fine but when the food service is slow this is a bit rich! We had 2 starters and 2 mains plus a bottle of house champagne and the bill was £221. Very expensive for what it was and we have paid less at far far better rated restaurants. My partner had the king prawn cocktail to start - it came with a finger bowl but then only one king prawn placed on top and 2 slices of burnt (black) toast. I had the Tuna Sashmi which was served plain and an extremely small serving. We shared a steak for main - which was nice but the side portions (which you had to order separately) were again over cooked. The waiting staff were run off their feet - food took over half an hour to arrive and again between courses. The waitress was slightly inappropriate towards my partner which was uncomfortable. All in all a waste of an experience. We went to the Ivy City Garden the following night and can not recommend that place enough. Save your money and avoid. Might have been better just going for a drink on the roof top which did have good views (if you can get in).

title: Don't go for the food, just the views and bar
comment: We went on a work event and the food was awful. We waited over an hour for the starters and then when the mains came, which were nearly all steaks, the quality of the meat was poor and they were not cooked to order. The food standards are very poor given the status of the hotel and restaurant. The waiting staff were excellent though and did their best to make good of a poor situation but they were seriously let down by poor chefs/kitchen. The roof top bar was excellent though, very spacious, good service and great views.

title: Turned into a good summer Friday night out!
comment: When we arrived after work the outdoor rooftop was over crowded as it was a warm Friday night. We didn't get serviced at the bar for a while and when mentioned to the manager he just shrug us off, not much service or conversation from him. However inside the DJ was excellent and it was buzzy and not so crowded with the chill house tunes spinning. The food options are relaxed yet tasty. We had the lobster in the brioche with fries. The restaurant service was excellent. Overall was a great place for a summer Friday night.

title: Nice meal, but couldn't get access to rooftop bar
comment: Having been enticed into coming for dinner by the rooftop bar, we were a bit disappointed not to be able to go out onto it! There was a queue before dinner and after dinner they were not allowing people out with drinks and it closed soon after. My husband waited for a drink for 20 minutes on his arrival, but we did have a nice meal of the bone in ribeye with fries and creamed spinach and we had a good waiter.

title: Nice rooftop bar but pricey
comment: Nice rooftop bar in the City. Have been lucky enough to go twice and not queue on either occasion but I imagine this will get busier once more people know about it. Pretty good view towards the Gherkin etc. Drinks are quite pricey and not a great wine selection. Could for a couple to start your evening off.

title: Top Draw
comment: Really lovely place. Took my parents and partner after a recommendation from a colleague.  Food was fantastic, the service was great, and the views are wonderful.  Unfortunately it was chucking it down so we couldn’t sit out on the roof terrace which is lovely, but still worth a visit even for the inside.  Lovely touch to have the live music while you eat too.  Defitnately recommend it.

title: A fab Sunday brunch at the Aviary
comment: after staying at the Montcalm recently decided to rteurn to London for lunch, we had sunday brunch at the Aviary and it was wonderful. It was fairly quiet but still a good atmosphere, food was excellent and not too expensive considering the Aviary is based in a 5 star luxury hotel, would definitely return

title: Great view, disappointing service, OK food
comment: I took a group of 6 others here for a business lunch. While the views didn't disappoint, the service did. And the food was fine, but not noteworthy. What keeps this place popular is absolutely the rooftop view. As one of the only open-air, classy rooftop places in this part of the city - it's guaranteed to be busy. And the setting/ambiance is great.  When it comes to service, there were 3 critical issues, which I would not expect from a restaurant at this price point.  1) One member of our group was a vegan. The server did not seem to have ever heard the term "vegan" before and struggled to understand the guests' request to confirm vegan options on the menu. Luckily, the chef was then able to accommodate and confirm vegan options.  2) When I asked for detail on a particular dish (the Salmon Nicoise) and what it contained, I was given an answer that there were no additional ingredients beyond the 4 items listed on the menu, meaning it didn't contain the classic "Nicoise" salad add-ons. I did not order this dish, but when another member of our group did, it was immediately clear, that it contained numerous components of a classic Nicoise that were not in the menu description.  3.) Another guest at the table inquired about one of the three sauce options for fish, which is simply titled "green sauce". He asked for more detail on what the "green sauce" contains, what flavor, etc. The reply from the server was "I don't know anything about it. It's just a green sauce".  It's entirely possible that this server had just begun working at the restaurant and wasn't deeply familiar with the menu, but even if that is the case, I content there is still an issue of perhaps not adequate training, and definitely in the server not being accomodating and helpful. I would not expect this from a place that is charging GBP 20-40 for mains. At that price point, I expect a higher level of service.  All of the food we had was good and it was tasty, but not remarkable, and certainly tainted by the service experience.

title: Roof Top Brunch
comment: We love our brunches at roof top bars and restaurants and this has been added to the list of favourites. Yes it's a bit pricey but if you want a place that has chilled vibe and fit a treat it is definitely a place to try.

title: Caesar Salad served in a balti Skillet ???
comment: Noisy very noisy thud thud music played in the restaurant, l thought restaurants were for eating and meeting ? Caesar salad definitely give it a miss, served in cast iron skillet more akin to hot balti dish. Chicken tasted broiled not grilled no presentation, taste or thought . Chef needed to sacked sending out a dish looking and tasting like that.All in all what was to be a meal with friends was very disappointing.

title: An Excellent Meal With A View
comment: I enjoyed an exceptional Dover Sole when I went to dinner here. The service is spot on. They have a good menu selection and a very nice wine list. The views are terrific. It is priced a bit above moderate and worth every pound. This is a hot spot. If you want a table with a view, make a reservation.

title: Amazing view!
comment: We stayed at this hotel and had breakfast at the Aviary- would defo recommend it was amazing! View was just something else.

title: Great food, amazing view, but don't go if you are in a hurry
comment: The food is mostly fantastic, with a few exceptions. Good price range, from affordable to unreasonable (£90 for an admittedly good chunk of meat, but definitively not worth the price tag).  The wine list is very good but the beer list is bad. Heineken?! Seriously? "Sure, I'd love some piss supermarket beer with my £90 steak" Okay, to be fair they have two good bottles of beer on offer, but that is not good enough. Staff is truly lovely and friendly but service is always a bit slow. Don't go in a hurry.  I also feel the level of product knowledge from staff is lacking on many fronts (outside bar server didn't know what Pimm's was for example). Overall the place is very good and I'd recommend it. It has the potential to be excellent  Luckily for me I've only been there for leisure business lunches and time was not an issue, however as

title: Overhyped, overpriced.
comment: London is full of amazing places to eat, drink and have fun - this isn't brilliant, to be honest. The decor is quite nice and, had the weather been better, the rooftop bar would be a good place to hang out. Anyway, the food was pretty ordinary, very expensive/over-priced and the service was awful. They got our order wrong so one of us didn't get food at the same time - pretty much when the rest of us had finished and our hot sides were cold. They couldn't find a second bottle of the wine we ordered and took so long about it that we ran out of time to order a different one. They asked if we wanted desserts and then never came back for our order. We paid and left. Not a great experience.

title: Overhyped, Overpriced, Bland, Ridiculous Restaurant
comment: This restaurant is one of the poorest I have been in my life. The food over priced, bland, over sold under delivered. The waiter took so much time explaining in ever detail the food and specials I was literally pleaded for him to go away. The wine is outrageously expensive. The restaurant is disorganised and staff clearly interested in getting guests in and out as quickly as possible and putting on a theatrical show. We both had the duck starter, one word bland. I had lamb main, rubbery and impossible to chew. My wife had a steak again tasteless and not lean. We didn't bother with dessert or coffee even though the hovering waiter put on his second act of selling the plainly bland and unimaginative choices to us. Just don't go, it's full of people wanted to be seen and the staff are the same. It's a real pity as we stayed at the hotel which was superb. Very very poor don't go unless you are vacuous and have no pallet and have money to burn and like a waiter that shadows you throughout your meal Truly dreadful.........

title: Food was ok, but pricey!
comment: Used the restaurant as we were staying in the hotel. Food was nice but along with the drinks it is very pricey!  Service could be improved as we sat down before 2 other couples and even though it was very clear we were ready to order drinks/food we were ignored and the other couples served first; with their drinks etc being brought to their table before we were even acknowledged again for our order to be taken.  I would recommend this restaurant more for drinks as it has a great outside area with nice views.

title: Go for the view, not the food....
comment: A friend and I decided to try Aviary for dinner - we were a little early so decided to have a drink on the rooftop bar. The space is lovely, with a nice view of the city, they manage the no. of people outdoors, so it wasn't too crowded, and that's the only positive thing I can say about our evening. We were told off for being 10mins late to our table, despite letting them know as soon as we arrived that we were having a quick drink before dinner. Our waiter was rude - didn't offer to explain the menu, looked bored, and thankfully kept away from us for the most of the evening. We both ordered prawn cocktails at £15 as a starter, which was topped by one prawn, accompanied by lettuce with tiny bits of prawn mixed through - well mine had tiny bits, my friend had to send hers back because it was just lettuce. The mains were ok (my local pub does better), and we didn't bother with dessert. When we came to pay the bill, we weren't charged for either of our mains. To be honest, I don't know if this was a mistake or an acknowledgement of the issues with the food & service because nothing was said, and we just wanted to get out of there. The fact the restaurant wasn't busy on a Friday night was probably a bit of a give-away.

title: Top prices. Fawlty service.
comment: Dined here last night with my wife for our anniversary. Sadly the star of the evening was the manageress who refunded two glasses of wine without being asked. To summarise !! The sparkling water ordered when we arrived didn't appear until the 3rd time of asking.The waiter had to tear up a beer mat to stabilise the wobbly table (after we asked). Waiter poured two glasses of wine and left bottle in a bucket on a stand 6 feet away from the table but i think that was to give me exercise as that was the only glass he poured !! The starters were good but nothing special. "crispy duck" refers to the breadcrumb coating surrounding it not the duck by the way !! My wife enjoyed her sashimi. 5 mins before our sharing Bone in Rib (£90) arrived i ordered a nice Malbec. 10 minutes later - well into the meal i was told it wasn't in stock so ordered a different Malbec. 10 minutes later it still hadn't arrived so i had to get up and ask the waiter to cancel the bottle and change for 2 glasses of wine which thankfully turned up (as i polished off my last mouthful) The steak by the way was absolutely delicious. We ordered skinny and "thrice" cooked chips. I wondered where this "thrice" cooked potato delicacy had got to and discovered later it had made it's way to our bill but not the dinner table. Couldn't be bothered to complain at this point. The bill was £212 for 2 starters, a pint, a G&T a bottle of Albarino a sharing main and 3 sides. The manageress kindly refunded the two glasses of red without an utterance of complaint from me so must have known it wasn't great yet they weren't tempted to take off the service. Now the upside to all of this is that i spend £3-4K a month entertaining clients and now know to avoid. Sadly my wife had no such choice. I honestly do not mind paying up but the service has to be good and this was shocking. My bad.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: WOW! Where did they find OLIVIER!! Top class, service, attention and food. Thank you so much for helping make a wonderful birthday weekend! #lovetheAvaiaryxxx

title: Considering it's pretentious!
comment: Horrible, slow service! The manager had to take our order. Tough rump steak and simple double cheese burger dry and charred and as small as a big mac for 16 gbp. Amazing view...but the outside area does not allow drinks after 10 pm.

title: Great Roof Top Bar
comment: I haven't stayed at the hotel but have been to this bar a few times. While the inside is great, the rooftop area is fantastic. Great decor and amazing views. I would recommend booking a table as it very popular but fortunately they do restrict the number of people allowed in the rooftop space so my advise is unless you have a reservation, get there early! It is a great place to go if you're looking to impress someone!

title: Pretentious
comment: We came here for drinks and while the view of London on the rooftop bar is wonderful, the staff working on the rooftop really need to get over themselves, so pretentious it was as though we were lucky to be spending money here.There is no excuse on a sunny evening in London for a bar charging £7 for a bottle of beer to be so poorly staffed, colleagues had to wait so long to be served and there was no apology from the bar staff. I will not be returning. But I guess they probably won't care.

title: The view and decor is wonderful!
comment: I came here for lunch on a sunny afternoon with a colleague. The decor of the restaurant is stunning and the rooftop terrace is wonderful - sweeping views across Finsbury Square and got a great deal of sun. Plenty of outdoor seating too, which is rare for London! The service was also great - attentive without being overbearing. The food was a bit lacklustre to be honest - my colleague ordered the shrimp and lobster baguette which was mostly mayonnaise, and the chips on my fish and chips were a little overcooked and dry. However, the venue itself and the service is what provides the real wow factor. Now my expectations for the food have been reined in, I will definitely return on a sunny day but maybe for a quick snack and a few beers rather than for a meal.

title: Nice place but way too overpriced
comment: My title says it all. It is a nice place, provides a nice venue and a nice roof top view... ... but £11.5 for 125ml prosecco or £16 for egg benedict... common !!! That's 2-2.5 x reasonable prices. Very pretentious place... worth one time visit but I would personally not return.

title: Appalling Service
comment: I researched this place and it had many great reviews and an amazing rooftop view to top it all off, so i thought this might be the perfect place for my birthday meal with a group of my close friends. I was very wrong! After we sat down, we must have waited for about 45 minutes to even be asked if we would like any water, never mind about taking the order for our food/drinks. Twice I was followed all the way from from my table to the restroom, this also happened to a few of my friends. It made us feel very intimated and unwelcome. On a positive note, the food was pretty good but I shall not be attending here ever again or recommending this place due to the poor staffing and the way I felt discriminated against. I am very surprised this happened here as this is a well established restaurant and I feel that for the amount of money my friends and I spent that night, it definitely isn't worth it.

title: Great view
comment: Loved being on the rooftop overlooking the city. Drinks were a little expensive but not especially so for London - Plus you get the amazing view!

title: rooftop bar
comment: Only went for a drink but was very impressed. Has a lovely view and the decor is stunning. It has a very well stocked bar inside and also a small bar outside which is open when busy. Well worth a look and the hotel itself looks beautiful too!

title: Best Brunch!
comment: We booked a table of 10 for brunch following our son's 18th birthday party the night before and could not have chosen better. The food selection, both buffet and a la carte, was super and our experience was made even better by the wonderful Olivier who is I think the new Breakfast Manager? He was helpful and charming and when he found out we had been celebrating our son's 18th birthday offered us complimentary mimosas. The room itself is light and airy and despite a warm morning was beautifully cool thanks to efficient air conditioning. The outside terrace is also beautiful with great views of the London skyline. Will definitely be back!

title: Fantastic meal and setting
comment: I had a delightful evening at the bar and restaurant. The service was outstanding as was the quality of the food. The Beef Wellington was prepared per my request. I would also recommend the desserts - I wanted to have one of each!. The restaurant and bar on the roof-top and offer a wonderful sky-line view of the city and you can enjoy the outdoor setting, weather permitting.

title: So cool
comment: Loved it. Great mixed menu with nice sides. Service is luxury and the views are to die for. Will be back soooon

title: Great food, views and atmosphere
comment: The Aviary Rooftop bar and restaurant is modern and stylish, and offers great views over London City. The food and drinks are great, though quite pricy. Having said that, the service and atmosphere, in combination with the good quality food, justify the high prices.

title: Really busy for a good reason...
comment: Went here to celebrate our 30th anniversary and this was a treat from start to finish. Great views from the 10th floor of the Montcalm Hotel, lovely welcome and service particularly from Annette, excellent botlle of house red and 3 courses of high quality, well presented food. First time I had seen Retired Cow on a menu so much enjoyed my sirloin on the bone, lovely fish starters and lemon sole for my wife, and indulgent chocolate desserts for us both. Really busy which created a buzzy atmosphere, it's not cheap, but there was nothing we didn't thoroughly enjoy. Highly recommended

title: A fabulous restaurant ...
comment: To celebrate my birthday, we booked the little-known Aviary Restaurant at the top of the Montcalm Royal London House. I say little-known as I have dined at top of the Heron and Oxo Towers and The Shard many times and never heard of the Aviary. Wow, it was fabulous! We had drinks on the outside terrace which from the 9th floor gives a wonderful view of the City’s skyline. We then went into dinner. From the moment we sat down, our waiter Drew was attentive and made the best recommendations for food, I can’t remember what it’s called but the hollandaise sauce with marmite was sensational! Starters were delicious, fresh and very large portions. The highlight of the meal was the steaks, possibly one of the best I have eaten in a while, all served with thrice cooked chips and sauces. No one rushed us and we were allowed to sit and admire the views and chat. I couldn’t fault the food, the service, or the ambience. Prices were not cheap, but for a special occasion and from a restaurant of this calibre it is worth every penny. This restaurant is a class act and equally as good if not better than it's rivals on top of the nearby towers. I can’t wait to go back.

title: Amazing
comment: We dined at the aviary several times durinģ or visit to london. Every visit was special with the most fantastic staff we could have asked for. We were made to feel extra special with an additional surprise as it was my mother in laws birthday on the first evening we received a special desert to celebrate. All staff deserve a massive thank you for making us feel extra special. One lass in particular was very friendly and down to earth and we could have chatted all day as she was an asset to the aviary. I wish I remembered her name but unfortunately didn't catch her but she commented about my perfume being lovely during breakfast! I really would have loved to let her know before we left how much she made us feel special! Would go again anytime! The rooftop bar we only used for taking photographs but makes the montcalm miles ahead of the competition!

title: Great food/atmosphere
comment: We were staying in the Montcalm Hotel as guests and the server suggested we at least review the restaurant called the Aviary on the top of the hotel. We thought it would be good to at least see what all the fuss was about.  Good food in pleasant/vibrant surrounding with amazing views of the London skyline. The Houmous Starter is generous and I had the Iron Steak with my wife having the salmon. Not the cheapest place to eat, but typical of London prices. We will be back.

title: Consistently terrible service
comment: Second time visiting the terrace bar to enjoy a sunny day in London. I was going to leave 3 stars as I only have complaints about the service and cleanliness, but as it is the second time service is terrible, I give it two. First time my food never arrived despite having ordered it - credit to the manager who discounted the bill. Second time, blatently ignorant waiter who when asked (after various attempts to get attention) what freshly squeezed juices you have, said all of them (but there is no menu to read). When I went to ask the barman, turns out they have 3 and all are bottled (and 'freshly squeezed'). I wouldnt really take this against many places, but does this claim to be a 5 star place?! Lovely view.. will come again equipped with patience

title: Strangely the stuffed birds don't have an effect on your appetite.
comment: Ate breakfast at the Aviary a number of times, as a hotel guest. The views of the city are great and the buffet spread is extensive. The staff are efficient and courteous, so no issues on that front. I wish they would change the menu of the breakfast buffet more often though.

title: Amazing views of the City!
comment: Visited here twice during our stay at the Montcalm Royal London House and was not disappointed. Service was a little slow but this was to be expected on a busy Saturday night and the views well made up for it. Highly recommend!

title: Incredible rooftop view of London
comment: We stumbled upon this place but are glad we stopped in. The drinks are a little pricey, but you pay for atmosphere and the view. A lively crowd and perfect setting to enjoy a sunny day in London. You're high enough to see quite a long distance at some of the best building in the skyline.

title: Nice view, nice bar, great service
comment: Nothing to complain about in this restaurant. We were with a large group. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We had a very nice group menu: Beetroot, goat’s cheese, blackberries, walnuts, truffle Suffolk chicken, black cabbage, cauliflower and pine nuts Coconut panna cotta, passion fruit, mango, white chocolate I really liked the Beetroot/goat cheese combo. I was a little bit afraid for the coconut panna cotta. In general i dont like coconut that much, but the preparation was excellent and very tasty.

title: Food was lovely!
comment: Took my better half here with the intentions of a nice bank holiday Sunday roast only to get there and find out they were not doing it as it was a bank holiday slightly miffed by that. anyway the menu has plenty of to offer so went with the flat iron steak and went with all the trimmings, recommend the Hodsons sauce which is hollandaise with marmite. very good service and once we had finished eating went out onto the balcony to have a few more drinks was a little windy but didn't have to ask for them to put the heaters on they did this straight away which was a nice touch also didn't have to go back and forth to the bar they took our drinks order from our seats also very good service. would recommend this restaurant however check with them regarding roast dinner before booking.

title: Loved this place!
comment: Great view, fab vibe, lovely service and delicious food. We had a great night here and it kicked out weekend off nicely.

title: Great food in a great setting
comment: We were staying at the hotel and wanted a late dinner on a Friday evening after a long day out and what a perfect way to end the day. We had a drink on the rooftop terrace where you get great views of the city and are kept warm with heaters everywhere and then ate in the restaurant (just inside). We ate an array of starters and particularly enjoyed the Kombu pork and crispy duck and the mains were equally delicious in particular the lobster, grilled prawns and chateaubriand which came with and amazing dipping sauce apparently made with marmite which I don't usually like but WOW. The service is friendly and impeccable and we were not made to feel rushed at all. There was an eclectic mix of people and great atmosphere too.

title: Wow
comment: The Aviary is a beautiful restaurant, with colourful real stuffed bird ornaments outside. It has a great view over Finsbury Square, and when the sun shines, it really brings the outdoor patio to life. The ambiance is so smooth and classy, with very professional, friendly helpful staff- you don't feel like you're in a hotel at all. It's owned by ETM group and the food boasts the familiar quality they are famous for. They are consistent with the presentation and high standard of food and I like that. I went for lunch and had the monk fish for my main along with spinach, greens with bacon and chunky chips. Delicious. Everyone else enjoyed their meal also. Good sized portions! My dessert was wonderful, too, a chocolate mousse, and we also got fudge and sweets at the end. I have no complaints!

title: Not cheap, but worth it
comment: £160 for 3 of us - but worth it. Good ambience. Great service. I'd go back in a shot. Individual main courses varied from £12 to £44 per head, but each was really delicious.

title: Extortionate but I've been numerous times..
comment: Drink prices are astronomical, costing approx. £10 for a beer or a spirit mixer. But I've been back a few times..so that says something. The atmosphere is great, the roof terrace & view is great, and service is great (which should be expected at the least considering the pricing). Perfect date drinks or after-work drinks. Definitely worth it just to use the urinals too..

title: Buzzing Restaurant with Great Food, Service & Views
comment: We had a great meal at Aviary, all dishes were delicious & well presented & staff polished & friendly. Views are terrific from most tables & the place has a real buzz. The attached bar has an open air terrace which is a magnet for the post-work crowd & we struggled to find a pitch, you can't book the bar even as a resident of the hotel. When we did bag a table we enjoyed excellent cocktails & friendly efficient table service.

title: Hidden Gem
comment: I thought I knew most rooftop bars in London but only discovered this by chance last night whilst looking for somewhere to have pre-dinner cocktails. Bar on the 10th floor is stunning, great place for people watching. Staff were some of the best I've encountered in London, all extremely polite and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Will definitely be going back. Cocktails and beer selection could do with improving but overall a great experience.

title: Fantastic!
comment: We had dinner at the Aviary following a recommendation from a friend. The restaurant had a good vibe and the views from the roof terrace are lovely. We had the chateaubriand (for two) and it was so delicious. If you can get booked in, it's definitely worth a visit.

title: Wonderful views!!
comment: Whilst I didn't eat in the restaurant I did sample some cocktails whilst enjoying the panoramic views to be had in this rooftop bar/restaurant. Lovely atmosphere to enjoy your meal and drinks!

title: Great potential, not there yet
comment: Went for a birthday party with a dozen others. The bar was busy, but we got a table for drinks. Music wasn't too loud, so we could hear each other talk! Considering it's a roof terrace and that's why we went, we couldn't get on the terrace because it was full and there was a queue for it. We couldn't be bothered standing and waiting, so we stayed in the bar. Moved on to our dinner table, the service was a little slow and waiting staff seemed a little inexperienced. Stuff got forgotten, and it didn't appear that there was a problem of too few staff for the diners, just poor training or experience.  The food was very good, in particular the venison, most people in the group seemed very happy. Some compleints were made over the bill which was incorrect and the service hadn't been great. It was reduced and a free drink for the group worked well. Not sure I'd go back, but on a sunny, but less busy day it might be worth a try again.

title: Relaxing Sunday Lunch
comment: Although the restaurant turned out to be surprisingly quiet, four of us had pre-booked a Sunday lunch at this lovely rooftop venue. We received a warm welcome and were seated at a window table with great views over the London skyline. The food was not overpriced, beautifully presented and very tasty. The staff were friendly and attentive throughout. Well worth a visit.

title: Great venue...some problems with the food
comment: The Aviary feels special. We likened it to some of the restaurants we've visited in New York City. A lovely experience, spoiled slightly by the kitchen's inability to clean prawns properly (which we sent back twice). The management took them off the bill and compensated us so all was good. It certainly wouldn't stop us going back again...if only for a drink on the rooftop bar!

title: great view!! its a must!
comment: you MUST have a drink or lunch/breakfast there. its just amazing! very polite staff as well. They have the best breakfast!

title: Looking The City in the eyes
comment: Great place and view of the City. I had dinner there and I was pleased by the quality of the seafood.

title: Fantastic evening
comment: We went to the Aviary on a Saturday night with a table booked. They had originally put us on a table meant for 3 people but moved us without hesitation when we'd asked for a more romantic 2-person table. Don't be discouraged by the small selection of cocktails, they do all the classics too but don't advertise that! The service from our waitress Maria was impeccable, nothing was too much trouble and we had lots of questions before ordering our food. We shared the crispy duck, rice noodles and duck egg to start, which was delicious, and as we didn't want to order a second starter, Maria recommended a side order of bread which was outstanding! No joke it was some of the best bread we have ever tasted! For mains we shared the flat iron steak and lemon sole. Both of which were cooked to perfection. We had brown butter sauce with the sole which was sublime. For dessert we shared the Easter themed Eggs Bunnydict which was so lovely and really thought through as a concept! Will be recommending to all of my friends.

title: Fantastic views!
comment: What a find and great views over the city. The food was immaculate and very enjoyable especially the Brill. The service is a little hit and miss and table service can take an eternity to get noticed or served even though quite a few people working.

title: Trendy roof top bar and restaurant
comment: Great food, top class service and stunning views of the London skyline....a must visit. Prices in line with a luxury hotel but worth the little extra for the quality.

title: Great Birthday
comment: We tried to book the Shard for my birthday but it was fully booked, thank God, as the Aviary was excellent from start to finish.  As a group of nine we were concerned with how close the tables were to the bar. We also had some fussy palates with us, but after liaising with Gintare the events co-ordinator all of our concerns were put to bed. The evening was fantastic. We sat down for an 8 o'clock booking and did not leave until midnight. The service was great, the food was great, the atmosphere was great,. We will be going back when the nights get warmer to take advantage of the terrace over-looking the city.

title: Great views of London with an adjacent outdoor terrace
comment: Good menu if a bit limited; great staff, very friendly, but some struggle to speak English. Slow service but made up for by spectacular views. Expensive, but you'd expect that in such a location. Separate reception so lots of non hotel guests using the restaurant and terrace. Heaters and blankets on the terrace

title: Wonderful! Highly recommend
comment: I visited the restaurant with a friend to celebrate my birthday and was not disappointed. The menu was varied, we had a steak to share which was perfect along with thrice cooked chips. The pudding was gorgeous and the drinks menu was also great.  Food perfect  Service wonderful - staff very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable about the food and drinks offering great recommendations  Venue and views were wonderful.  We even sat at the bar and had cocktails after our meal as we didn't want to leave. The live DJ added to the atmosphere and going outside onto the terrace is a must. Shame we couldn't take drinks out after 10 but this didn't matter. We left feeling like we'd had a wonderful and special evening.  Very reasonably priced and worth every penny.  I will visit again and will recommend

title: Great views, great decor, great drinks..
comment: This feels like a bit of a hidden gem, on top of the Montcalm. Came up here lateish on a Thu night and was amazed at how nice it was. We only had drinks, but it feels like a little members bar in the city, and the rood terrace is superb with views across to heron tower and tower 42..  Cocktails were good and strong, although fairly expensive..  Will be back..

title: Outstanding Venue
comment: Visited Friday night for a late dinner. Bar and restaurant both really busy, fantastic vibe. Food was outstanding as was the service. Very much worth a visit.

title: Delicious meal with great views
comment: We booked into the Montcalm Hotel after a long day of walking around London. We didn't fancy heading out again and so decided to stay and eat at the hotel. We hadn't booked a table but the staff were really friendly and managed to fit us in at the bar. The food was absolutely delicious and service was excellent and it was a real treat to walk down to our hotel room afterwards.

title: Birthday dinner celebration
comment: My husband had booked this new restaurant a few weeks ago to try to obtain a window table for us four to celebrate my birthday dinner last night as he was told the views over London are spectacular. Upon booking confirmation also this was requested again but nothing could be guaranteed. We arrive and go out on to the rooftop, which is quite amazing and enjoy this before going into the bar. We enjoy our drinks and then are seated. We are allocated a corner table away from the window, OK i think, shame but not a problem. My husband however was disappointed. Two things I immediately noticed as we were seated, that as it was so cold I had to keep my coat on whilst eating and most importantly was how loud the music was. We found talking amongst us was a real problem. Our daughters are mid twenties and they even found the music overpowering! As we go to order the food our waiter tells us that he will grab a pencil then come straight back. Well, we don't see him for another 30 mins or so but manage to attract other servers attention to get this done. Two lemon sole, off the bone are ordered and a chateaubriand to share for my husband and I. Food arrives, the lemon sole is still on the bone and has to be sent back and the chateaubriand is too blue for me, sadly this to goes back too. We are starving by now as the waitress also correctly takes away the fries to be returned with the adjusted food. My husband really enjoys the steak and our girls still need to pick away the bones from the fish. All in all not a great experience. Ate with coat on, loud music triggered my tinnitus and we were charged a second bottle of mineral water that we did not ask for. I found the staff running around like mad people and some not so helpful, especially front desk man with red trousers. Want to put this behind me now!

title: Perfect NYE meal.
comment: We ate here on NYE and although the table was at 6.30, we were allowed on to the roof terrace after to enjoy the evening. (at no extra cost) The service we received from start to finish was great, the food was exceptional. We were really impressed. Cocktails too were superb. All in all a top restaurant and venue. I would recommend.

title: Expensive for what it is
comment: I dined at the Aviary while staying at the Montcalm Hotel on my third visit. Although I was aware of its existence I ate elsewhere on my two previous stays (not very successfully, unfortunately). Now I've found the Aviary I will probably use it again when I'm staying at the hotel and I would be tempted to use it for client/staff lunches, but it's not cheap - just under £60 and I didn't have a starter or a dessert, with two glasses of wine accounting for £23! I had skate which I thoroughly and new potatoes slightly dry) and honey glazed carrots (too much honey, but tasty). My concern is that although the food was fine it wasn't that memorable and if three or four us went there for a meal the bill would be very high and I would expect something memorable if that was the case.

title: Great space / view, poor service
comment: Managed to reserve a space outside on the terrace a week in advance, but when we turned up they didn't honour it and then squeezed us to a small table inside. The space is well designed and has a great view from the outside terrace however the amazingly slow and inattentive service lets it all down so badly. The limited bar food menu that we ordered was poor quality as was a couple of cocktails which needed to be sent back. It's a very noisy space, so avoid if you need to actually have a conversation!  They did comp a bottle which was generous indeed but sadly won't be returning and not recommending.

title: GREAT VIEWS
comment: Great bar with excellent views of the city price's are fair for a place of this quality can highly recommend

title: Amazing!!!
comment: Absolutely amazing meal best restaurant I've ever been to view is amazing food is fantastic staff are so friendly really really recommend it!!!!!

title: Great food
comment: We had very enjoyable dinner here. I absolutely loved the tuna sashimi and the 1/2 chicken was also very good. My boyfriend had prawns and the salmon and he really liked his meal as well. Also very reasonably priced! Will come back to check out the rooftop bar in summer. It was raining when we went but it seemed like there was a very nice view.

title: Spectacular view, great bar
comment: Set on the top floor of the Montcalm hotel in Finsbury Square, the views are wonderful and when the sun sets, the lights of London make it a magical experience. The staff are friendly and attentive, the selection of drinks and cocktails really excellent, and the music relaxing.

title: Worth the treat
comment: Clearly the view at Aviary is worth a visit alone but the food and service are also excellent.  It's a little out of my usual price range, but I would say it's totally worth the treat. The food was delicious, and portion sizes generous. The raw platter is a show stopper, we also had steaks and a shared a few sides which were all lovely. Service was excellent, Natalie was very attentive and friendly, I couldn't fault her. As we went on a Friday night the bar area was packed, so it was a little loud to start off with but I guess that's what you'd expect somewhere that makes such lovely cocktails and has that view.  I will definitely be visiting in the summer for cocktails on the terrace.

title: Best for steaks
comment: The restaurant staff were very good - and we enjoyed our cocktails - but the layout of the room is not so great as the bar area and the dining tables (too close to each other) overlap.  Turning to the meal, the main courses are primarily 'steak with sauce of choice'. I went for the fish which was OK but dull. Triple cooked chips were great.

title: Excellent setting
comment: We enjoyed an excellent meal here. The staff very helpful and the food excellent standard. Although take note it's very busy on a Friday evening so not a place to eat if you want somewhere quiet!

title: Incredible location, great bar
comment: Only had drinks here, haven't eaten. But this location is amazing and the bar itself has such a good feel. Can't recommend enough!!

title: Fantastic Bar with stunning views
comment: Great breakfast spreads accompanied by stunning views. By evening the bar has some great cocktails - Must try!!! Very talented bartenders! Our fav was Jannis - he just cheered my friend up by serving an exquisite classy shots. Fantastic!!! The decor is very contemporary and the Terrace is not to be missed!

title: Nice buzz and attentive service ( plus great views)
comment: This restaurants service was certainly attentive and all the staff could not do enough to ensure you were looked after. The big selling point is the location in the 9th floor so you have a great view of the city of London . After dinner we sat outside in the patio area with a glass of wine ( under a heater! ) Food is reasonably priced and was good. It's not gourmet but the menu provides a Nice selection for all tastes. Big selection of meat dishes but also plenty of options for vegetarians. The restaurant itself is smart and has a nice buzz, I think it would also be a good place if you just wanted drinks.  Would I go back..yes and I think on a spring / summers evening it would be a great place with a bottle of white wine and friends.

title: Very high quality food
comment: My girlfriend and I had the sashimi and the Scottish salmon - Both courses were amazing. The staff were very friendly as well. Highly recommend.

title: Fantastic rooftop bar in the city
comment: Great rooftop bar in the city, outside area with heaters overlooking the square and top bartenders who were really engaging and made excellent cocktails

title: Not very special New Year's Eve
comment: I was disappointed about this special event. Dj and her music was nothing special for celebration of the arrival of the New year 2017. Also disappointing was that there was very limited menu with cocktails and we couldn't order any food at 23.00. That was really shame as at the bar menu there were some snacks but I have been told that they can offer either olives or smoked almonds. When I saw the place online while purchasing the tickets I expected it to be night and party full of fun, tasty drinks and good food.  The view was very nice but we didn't see fireworks just some small lights far away. That was problem of the area probably which is manly full of offices so nobody was there except people in the bars and restaurants. I expected a little bit more from the place and event as well. The place was very nice so I will give them a second try just for coffee or some drinks to see how it is and how they do during the day.

title: Awesome Roof bar with Great views and even better Restaurant
comment: This is the future of London roof top bars & Restaurants with amazing views. Since it opened 2 months ago I have dined here 3 times and drinks many times more on the roof top. It's amazing the food is absolute best of British as very reasonable prices. the Sirloin on the bone is Huge and amazing, the Confit of Duck egg insane and the triple dipped chips to die for. This will be the place to be come the spring and I hate to imaging the queue come Summer! Well done guys - Awesome!!!!

title: Other restaurants can learn from Aviary
comment: I almost didn't get to Aviary. I'm usually a West End Diner; City territory is generally out-of-bounds after the working day, especially for a Friday evening. But thanks to DesignMyNight, Aviary had invited me for a meal as part of its continuing launch offer. Great, I thought - until I had the disappointment that there was no availability. So it was with some surprise I received a call from Aviary on Friday afternoon, with a reminder about the booking they had in their system for later that evening. Other plans had beckoned but those were easily dismissed; I'd liked the philosophy behind Aviary's menu and I wasn't about to turn them down. I'm very glad I followed through. It's a fantastic location, at the top of the Royal Montcalm on Finsbury Square. January wind and rain made the terrace inaccessible on this occasion, but I'll look forward to coming back in better weather; the views are well worth it. But the food is truly good, the wine list is very acceptable, and the service was without fault. Starting with a selection of oysters was a shrewd move, for we'd ordered the chateaubriand to share. The oysters were perfectly shucked (always a good test of the restaurant's attention to detail) and were served with well-flavoured sauces (including a fulsome sesame soy). I'd asked the waiter to let chef cook the chateaubriand as he saw fit, which was somewhere between rare and medium rare. Good choice for a spectacular cut of beef. Full of flavour and incomparably tender, the steak knives really weren't needed, for this sliced like butter. My wheat intolerance is always a hassle when dining out, but here the staff made no fuss about it. Pudding was the most obvious example; a special creation of the chocolate mousse ensued, and was again perfect in every way. Was there anything wrong with Aviary? If I had to find fault, it would be the juxtaposition of bar and restaurant; the tables could do with some greater separation, and I'd imagine that with a very busy bar, noise could be an issue. But that's only a minor niggle, and I'll definitely be trying to make my way back. Although if all the reviews are as effusive - I wonder if I will be able to get a table again!

title: Impressive as a bar, also great as a restaurant
comment: I finally got to go to Aviary for dinner, having been there a few times before for drinks. It's an interesting environment. High class, expensive, lovely. But also a bustling, loud bar. Makes for an interesting demographic for a romantic dinner, but it's fun to be part of the action. The oysters are TO DIE FOR. The sauce that came with it is one of the most delicious things ever, it somehow manages to add superbly to the taste without taking away from the flavour of the oysters. Can't recommend enough. The pork entree was also very delicious (ordered by my date). The deer main was incredible. Some odd flavour combinations that I wasn't so keen on, but the deer itself was amazing. So tender, so delicious. The steak main was quite chewy, which I would have been a bit disappointed by if I had ordered it, but my date didn't mind it too much so I couldn't let it lower my personal rating. Apart from all that, the staff are great; very attentive and very professional. The location and the view are FANTASTIC. I really enjoy coming here, though the food is quite pricey (we were lucky enough to go during 50% off January), so special occasions only!

title: Vodka Lemonade and a Beer £20
comment: We were staying in the hotel and we were meeting friends for drinks in Shoreditch but we wanted to have a drink in the rooftop bar. My partner and I ordered one vodka and lemonade and a beer and the round came to nearly £20 which was pretty expensive but we were staying in London. We arrived around 9pm and the place we heaving for a fairly new restaurant/bar! We went outside to see the views on the rooftop and they really were amazing. If it wasn't for the fact it was February we would have stayed out there for longer. Next time we would probably eat too as the food looked great!

title: Excellent (if it wasn't for the music)
comment: The venue looks really good although it feels more like a bar than a restaurant. The staff were all great and especially our waiter (Ilias) was superb. Food from starters to mains to deserts all arrived promptly and tasted really good. From our table there was absolutely no view although a visit to the balcony later was really rewarding despite the cold weather. But the music..... Its not a matter of music taste or preference regarding the volume but even the staff couldn't hear us and we couldn't hear them. If this was just a bar where most people are standing this would be reasonable -maybe- but for a restaurant having a dj and such loud music makes it simply an obstacle rather than a source of entertainment. When it becomes slightly quieter I will certainly come back for dinner. In the meantime this is on my list for the first roof-top/ balcony bar I visit when the weather is better again!

title: Didn't realize it had not long been open. Lots of teething problems.
comment: Lots of teething problems mid December. Choice of beers on the menu but only 2 available. We ordered a beer each but brought us the wrong one. We waited over 20 mins to order food and had to ask for someone to take our order after this time. We ordered bread but took over 15 mins to arrive. Once we eventually got our food it was very good indeed, couldn't fault it. We ordered coffee, a double espresso each but we singles. We queried this and they assured us they were doubles but they weren't. The bar looks very cool and will be very popular in the summertime.

title: Cocktails and Great Food
comment: Drank cocktails on the balcony and then enjoyed a fantastic meal with colleagues recently. top notch!
